author: {'steamid': '76561198075742770', 'num_games_owned': 4012, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1705880390}
review:
As a follow-up to a former F2P decessor, it's a short sweet game. I was able to beat it just under a hour, in 57 mins specifically. It finds its own eeriness and awkwardness in its aesthetics while also has a pretty music selection. However, its bullet hell gameplay loop, while fun, obviously does not evolve much (but has a fair skill ceiling, combat gets faster and more agressive as you progress) and it does not include exploration outside the locations you must visit in order to collect hearts (after you heal the people you interact with) and perhaps collecting some chests. Chests are usually hidden in rooms that seemingly unreachable (blocked by objects) but if you simply walk up on a few of them you'll notice they are actually red herrings and you are able to move through some of the objects/walls. I find that lame but again in a 1 hour game it's barely a sin. The game does not get much creative in dialogues as it also does not in its gameplay loop. I find it kinda disappointing given these types of Retro RPGs (although it's really hard to call Princess Remedy a RPG) heavily relies on character interaction through three dimensional & heartfelt dialogues and a strong script overall. Being able to date with the people you cure therefore also being able to recruit them is a cool idea but their skills are usually lame and it's just another very simplistic game mechanic. 

Idk if we'll ever see a 3rd game but it could have been something if the right strings were pulled. Game ends with a sick dance qte tho.

review: Princess Remedy 2: In A Heap of Trouble is a short, simple game with a nostalgic charm. It combines classic RPG and bullet-hell elements as you play as Princess Remedy, healing quirky characters in a whimsical world. The pixel art and humor add to its appeal. While it's not groundbreaking and might leave you wanting more in terms of gameplay and content, it's an overall okay experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253551769', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1698246966}
review:
Princess Remedy 2: In A Heap of Trouble is a huge improvement over the first game. I spent roughly 2 and half hours on this game trying to beat it and I found the fights to be very interesting and challenging as well as I very much enjoyed the music and the character designs and witty dialogue. 

However, the boss fights are very difficult even playing on normal difficulty and the sequel has tons of boss fights. So I can't imagine playing on "Death" mode. 

Regardless, I had a blast playing this and I hope Ludosity makes a third game to this series. 
Although, I did not beat the game as I keep dying on very last part of the mega boss tower fight which is super frustrating but I played enough to get an overall opinion of this great game. 

Therefore, I would recommend you buy this as it's much more fun and improvement over the first game and definitely worth $5 or even cheaper on steam sale. 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023152183', 'num_games_owned': 895, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1685969041}
review:
This was quite a short and entertaining bullet hell.

For having such retro aesthetics and soundtrack one would probably pass it off as yet another nostalgia bait but in this case there's a theme, an odd one based on healing by shooting off creatures and gaining upgrades. The small dialogue there is gives the game some personality and there are some gags spread throughout that are kinda funny. Furthermore, with its 3 difficulty levels there is certainly a challenge and the precision becomes prime as you go on so you'll have to learn how to dodge properly sooner or later.

My main gripe is with the 102% completion requirement that the game doesn't tell you beforehand what it is until it's too late. Fortunately the game is short enough for a restart to not be a really big issue but it still is a problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047474483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1591038644}
review:
"Princess Remedy 2" is a retro "Rpg"/Exploration/ArenaShooter-Hybrid and a worthy successor to the first one, which is one of the best free games on steam. 

You play the titular alien princess/nurse that heals gorgeously weird characters from their maladies all her way up to the root of the corruption, while going out with various oddballs, that give her different special attacks and exploring the world for stat-upgrades. The low-res artstyle is extremely charming and creative and the gameplay is condensed and focused.

I managed to clear the first game on the hardest difficulty (which has extremely tight and infuriating moments), but never the second one! 
Play the first one and give the developer credit and support by playing the second one too!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986964830', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1592065027}
review:
NOTA: 4 de 10

Lo único rescatable de este título es su estilo y estética tan entrañables, aunque eso por supuesto es muy subjetivo.

Por lo demás, es un juego que no aporta nada al género que no se haya visto ya. Lo peor de todo es que es demasiado breve, y aún así se siente repetitivo y cansino.

La historia y el guión es de lo más kafkiano que uno se pueda echar a la cara, encima con sibilina propaganda ideológica.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166689637', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1664400088}
review:
tıp öğrencisi Remedy olarak amacımız, türlü türlü dertleri bulunan bütün her şeyi iyileştirmek. bunu da yaparken tuhaf, komik konuşmalara şahit oluyoruz. ayrıca iyileştirdiğimiz kişilerle sevgili olup, onların yardım özelliklerini alabiliyoruz. ben ilk sevgilimle oyunu bitirdim. blast özelliği için teşekkür ederim Camilla <3

oyunu %87 tamamlamayla 3 saatte (belki de daha az) bitirdim. oynarken keyif aldım. tabii daha da gezilecek, keşfedilecek yerler vardır fakat ben bulamadım. tekrar da oynamak istemedim.
normal fiyatı fazla gelebilir. ama indirimlerde büyük ihtimalle 3 lira civarı olur.
son olarak. ışığa duyarlı insanlar için oyun pek uygun olmayabilir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093545625', 'num_games_owned': 3014, 'num_reviews': 1146, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1571313042}
review: Огромная Башня Босса выросла из земли, поднимая вместе с собой целые города. Теперь люди, живущие на башне, начинают заражаться всевозможными таинственными болезнями. Принцесса Ремеди, все еще находящаяся в сатурнианской школе целительства, должна использовать свои силы, чтобы исцелить всех и победить Башню Босса!

author: {'steamid': '76561198194680793', 'num_games_owned': 3045, 'num_reviews': 1947, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1650802407}
review:
Очень милая игра, оформленная в ретро-стилистике, которая очень напоминает игры на "ZX Spectrum". По сюжету это предыстория игры "Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt", где принцесса Лекарство только ещё учится в магической медицинской школе. Огромная Башня Босса выросла из земли, поднимая вместе с собой целые города. Жители  привыкли к этому и продолжили жить в башне, но вскоре они начинают болеть. И вновь (точнее впервые, учитывая, что это приквел) нашей героине нужно всех излечить.
Что касается геймплея, то он аналогичен "Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt". Наша героиня исследует локации, лутает сундуки, апгрейдится, общается с местными жителями и лечит их. "Лечение" и есть основной геймплей. На аренах вам нужно истреблять все болезнетворные бактерии в прямом смысле слова. Роль боеприпасов выполняют таблетки и шприцы.
Чтобы разблокировать другие локации, нужно набрать необходимое количество сердец, которые получаете за каждого вылеченного. Так и ходите, зачищая организмы бедных жителей.
В общем, это милая игра, с приятным визуалом и музыкой, выполненная в духе игр "ZX Spectrum". Знающие люди могут словить нотку ностальгии. Сама игра непродолжительная и не особо сложная (есть и другие режимы сложности). Есть поддержка геймпада.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995205126', 'num_games_owned': 632, 'num_reviews': 743, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1646078785}
review:
[b]Princess Remedy In A Heap of Trouble[/b] to drobny, krótki, lecz również bardzo przyjemny tytuł z gatunku gier akcji, który zabiera gracza do tajemniczego świata fantasy w którym za pośrednictwem tytułowej księżniczki będzie podróżował po świecie gry w celu ratowania jej mieszkańców od tajemniczych niebezpieczeństw i dolegliwości które ich trapią.

Tytuł zaprezentowany jest w bardzo old-schoolwym wręcz nostalgicznym dla wiekowych już graczy stylu, który tworzy nieziemską atmosferę i daje możliwości na przyjemne spędzenia czasu.

[i]Mała dygresja:[/i]

1. Gra nie jest długa można ją całą przejść w niecała godzinę, choć wszystko będzie zależeć od waszej zręczności w posługiwaniu się kontrolerem.

2. Jeżeli tytuł was zainteresuje to zachęcam by poczekać na wyprzedaż, gra choć dobra to cena jest absurdalna biorąc pod uwagę oferowaną  zawartość tego tytułu.

[h1]Ale do rzeczy:[/h1]

Jak już zdołałem wspomnieć na samym początku tej recenzji mamy tym razem do czynienia z tytułem z gatunku gier akcji, który zabiera gracza do tajemniczego świata fantasy w którym za pośrednictwem tytułowej księżniczki będzie podróżował po świecie w celu ratowania jej mieszkańców od tajemniczych niebezpieczeństw i dolegliwości które ich trapią.

Cała rozgrywka polega na eksploracji świata, napotykaniu postaci niezależnych i leczeniu ich z posiadanych szkodliwych dolegliwości. Leczenie przybierać będzie postać potyczki w której księżniczka będzie walczyła z przeróżnymi  stworzeniami – jeżeli je pokonamy to osoba dotknięta chorobą wyzdrowieje. 

[h1]Dalej:[/h1]

Co ważne każda występująca postać w tym świcie posiada specjalne zdolności, w sytuacji kiedy postanowimy jej pomóc, wyleczymy ją, wtedy będzie ona skłonna przyłączyć się do naszej wędrówki i dodatkowo podzielić się tymi zdolnościami z nami – co urozmaici i wspomoże nam w walce z coraz to silniejszymi przeciwnikami. Należy jednak pamiętać że w naszej wędrówce może towarzyszyć tylko jedna postać niezależna, wybierając inna postać tracimy dodatkowe umiejętności / zdolności walki, które posiadaliśmy wcześniej.

Gra stopniowo zwiększa swój poziom trudności, daje możliwość walki z jednostkami typu Boss, które stanowią nie lada wyzwanie a ich pokonanie jest bardzo satysfakcjonujące. Na mapie również możemy spotkać ukryte „znajdzki” skrzyneczki z elementami podnoszącymi ogólne statystyki naszej postaci, definiowane kolorowymi znaczkami – warto je zbierać i szukać po całej mapie.

Powyższa produkcja jest bardzo przyjemna w odbiorze, sterowanie banalnie proste choć w czasie walki będzie to bardziej zręcznościowa zabawa w której wynik będzie zależny od umiejętności samego gracza – jeżeli polegniecie w walce, nic straconego, pojawicie się w tym samym miejscu i będziecie mogli spróbować ponownie.

[h1]Podsumowanie:[/h1]

Princess Remedy In A Heap of Trouble to drobny, krótki,  lecz również bardzo przyjemny tytuł z gatunku gier akcji, swoista old-schoolowa odskocznia od bardziej rozbudowanych growych  tytułów.


[quote][b]Szukasz więcej recenzji?[/b] Zapraszam.
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32785706/ ]Kurator walas85[/url]
Zachęcam wszystkich do obserwacji kuratora, by na bieżąco otrzymywać świeże informacje o nowo zrecenzowanych tytułach.[/quote]

review: In Princess Remedy 2 you again shoot bad things with your healing powers. The game is almost twice as long (75 vs 45 minutes) as the first one and is just tightly designed. Really nice music, retro graphics that actually stand out and solid combat that is just a bit too hard (IMO). The little conversations about people's (and plants'/ducks') problems and how they respond to you helping them are really charming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012034127', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1636074496}
review:
Take everything you liked about the first game and be ready to experience more of it, plus a few more bells and whistles. I really enjoyed the first Princess Rem and this was easily just as good. This time around, you can team up (sort of) with those you've helped and they modify your special ability, from bigger flasks, to teleports, to lasers. The enemies are just as nifty as ever in their simple designs and all the aesthetics are back too. And the music is pretty great, I must admit. Lastly, you can experience a small DDR-like mini game at the end with each of the people you save, and each of those has their own little song to dance to. Keep in mind, there's about 60 of them! It's a nice little touch.

I have nothing bad to say about PR. This is just a fun little series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037328214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1635635030}
review:
I enjoyed this game's predecessor so much that I played through [i]Princess Remedy 1[/i] three times in a row -- once for each difficulty level. That should illustrate the degree to which I was ready to enjoy [i]Princess Remedy 2[/i]. I was shocked by how outright bad this is in certain respects.

[u]Writing[/u]
This is the very first time I've encountered a game where I've honestly wondered if the writing was done by an AI. A significant amount of the in-game text is devoted to puzzling jokes about an NPC which are never funny any time they are encountered, and they just keep showing up. But at least I can look at them and think, "Ah, the author intended these to be funny." The jokes delivered by NPCs post-healing exist in an uncanny valley where I'm not even sure if they were supposed to be jokes at all. It's just a random bit of monologue that is maybe related to the character's quirk in some way. To make my perspective clear, I found the writing in the first game genuinely funny throughout, while here it's flat to a baffling degree.

[u]Gameplay[/u]
[i]Princess Remedy 1[/i] is often called a bullet-hell even though it isn't (except for maybe the final boss). This game leans into that descriptor far enough that it reveals weaknesses in its design. There just isn't enough precision in either the movement or the aiming to make navigating a field of bullets fun or interesting. I spent several of the boss fights actively trying to figure out the size of my own hitbox because it just isn't clear. There are also some miscellaneous changes that don't make much sense to me, such as changing the passive healing of the first game to a "drain" effect which is so slight in its impact that it might as well not even be in the game. Also, the stat growth feels so much more planned around that when you accumulate upgrades it doesn't even feel like they contribute anything because future enemies/encounters have been juiced to a matching degree. The "dating" system by which you can alter your subweapon is fine, although I rarely wanted anything other than the default flask weapon anyway.

I guess I should close with the things I did like about the game. It still emulates the visual style of a ZX Spectrum game, and this time around the visuals actually scale to match your chosen resolution, so that's a plus. Otherwise I can't recommend this at all, when the first game is better in basically every way and is free to boot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198188664927', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1634174279}
review:
[quote]Follow my Curator page, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41363546-Fruit-N-Doggie-Reviews/]Fruit N Doggie Reviews,[/url] so you can be updated whenever I post a new review.[/quote]
[h1]Overall Rating - Seriously Flawed ★★☆☆☆[/h1]

[h1]First Impressions[/h1] 
It's not very often that I'll play a free game on Steam, but once in a great while I'll find one that interests me. I wound up playing Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt (PR1) in 2016, and after getting a copy of its sequel, knew I'd have to tackle it at some point as well. Princess Remedy 2: In a Heap of Trouble (PR2) was released two years after its free counterpart, so the developers had an opportunity to make a game worth being purchased. Were they successful, or is Remedy in a world of trouble? 


[h1]Gameplay[/h1] 
For those familiar with the first game, PR2 is going to be quite the callback, because it's basically the same game all over again. You'll speak with ill NPCs, which bring up small environments with blocks and enemies, but instead of a Bomberman like section, it's an overhead shooter. Some of the obstructions will be indestructible, but most of them will break after being shot for a few seconds. Each successfully healed person will increase your HP, which is also necessary in order to challenge the bosses as they have minimal heart requirements before you can fight them. Defeating a boss will either increase the power of your projectile or how many you fire at once, so you certainly notice the difference after beating them. 

Along the way, you'll open treasure chests and seek out secret items that'll increase how much HP you regain from hitting enemies and how many times you can use your ability. Regaining your health is incredibly helpful, so you'll always appreciate getting HP stealing upgrades. The ability you'll use depends on who you select to bring along on your journey, with the effects ranging from defensive ones that'll refill your health to offensive moves like laser beams. When speaking with an NPC who could join you, it'll tell you the name of the ability, but that won't necessarily convey its effect. If you don't like the one you have now, you'll just have to try another NPC's ability to see if it's any better.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2627399141
[h1]Controls[/h1] 
Some indie games don't have controller support, so that is a benefit of PR2, and is how I played the game. Additionally, there's at least two options available for the keyboard controls. This should suit most people's preferences, although the inability to rebind keys is a downside. A clever design choice was having the run button in the overworld sections slow down the character during fights, so that you can carefully dodge tight bullet patterns. 

With the controls working well overall, I'd say the main downside is not having an ability to fire in one direction and strafe your character around attacks. It means that dodging and attacking enemies take place separately, because you have to face enemies in order to shoot at them. 


[h1]Story[/h1] 
Even though the title screen shows a dramatic image of Princess Remedy, there isn't an introductory cutscene or transition as you start up the game. Instead, you're standing in front of an NPC who provides a very distilled summary of what's taking place, with the expectation that you go out and start helping the sickly right away. One could applaud the developers for getting to the point, but it's so brusque that it feels clumsy and unimportant. The unintended attitude this expresses is along the lines of, “It's the same idea from last time, how much explanation do you need to start playing the game?”

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2627398764
[h1]Visuals[/h1] 
If there was one area that could have used some improvement it was the art style, as it's one of the weakest elements of the game. The intentional use of the black background does create a neat effect, sort of like a black velvet painting, but the art is too crude to be very impactful. In fact, it's so basic that I'm not sure what kind of creatures some of the NPCs are meant to be, and the humans look like giant heads with tiny bodies. 

This also applies to the environment, as it can be hard to get the proper sense of space and perspective in relation to trees and walls. I think the item that looked worst of all were the NPCs made up of two colors instead of one, because their bodies would be bisected awkwardly, with each half made up of only one of the two colors. 


[h1]Sound Design[/h1] 
The music of PR2 has an NES chiptune vibe to it because of the beep and boop noises used to make up the songs. For a short game, there's a good variety of songs for the different locations you'll travel to. Personally, some of the notes were a bit grating, but I liked how most of the game's soundtrack turned out in spite of that problem. Considering what the music is comprised of, it's not surprising that the sound effects are of a similar style, which meshed together well with PR2's overall presentation. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2627398669
[h1]Pros[/h1] 
🌟 There's a good difficulty curve in the game, as enemies get more aggressive and have larger bullet spreads the further you go. This also ties in nicely with the range of difficulty levels, though the hardest one seems to have taken it a bit too far based on all of the discussion posts about it. 
🌟 Instead of only having one boss fight, there's a handful of them scattered around. There are also some secrets you can find, such as another difficulty level and a hidden boss. 
🌟 Some of the dialogue is pretty funny. 


[h1]Cons[/h1] 
❌ All throughout the game there are references made to Wash-Olof and people being obsessed with him, but I haven't a clue who the heck that is. Turns out he's the first person you speak with, but I still don't understand the obsession. 
❌ The first game was free, so when I finished it in an hour, I wasn't surprised. I finished this game in about 70 minutes, and it costs $5. Those additional 10 minutes must have really been something. 


[h1]Tips[/h1]
🔍 Although its the enemies that actually harm you, the biggest obstacle tends to be the cramped arenas, as they almost always feel a bit small. Focusing on a few enemies so they are killed off quickly will help with this matter, and make encounters much more survivable. 
🔍 If you're struggling on a particular fight, looking for treasure chests or hidden power-ups may tip the scale so that you can overcome it. 
🔍 There's quite a few abilities, so you might want to test them out at some point to see what they all do. 


[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1] 
When I played this game on a whim, I wasn't expecting to finish it the same session that I first tried it, or that it'd be almost identical to the free game that preceded it. My expectations for the first game were quite low because it was a freebie, but there was enough fun for it to be worth killing 60 minutes of my time. With the developers announcing a sequel, I got the impression that PR1 was a prototype and test of concept to get feedback for a larger, more developed project. 

However, instead of a sequel that expanded on its humble origins, this one is a doppleganger that hasn't brought anything new except for a price tag. I don't begrudge a game developer for wanting to make some money off of their product, but why would anybody pay $5 to experience something that's available for free? As the, technically prequel, is such a dud, I don't recommend getting it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149661442', 'num_games_owned': 191, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1634381463}
review:
Princess Remedy in A Heap of Trouble is actually a sequel to World of Hurt but I’m combining my review for both games since they are quite similar. The Princess remedy games are fun retro style romps where you explore towns and villages and fight viruses in small battle minigames. The game tracks your progress by number of NPCs cured where the more people you cure the more areas you unlock.

Every time you attempt to cure someone you enter what is essentially a mini arena in which you have to kill all enemies before you can proceed. With each person cured, these battles get progressively harder. The game balances challenge and engagement well, and you never feel like battles are unfair or get too frustrated from losing. Other than its fun gameplay, Princess Remedy is aided by its clever writing and excellent soundtrack.

The Princess Remedy games are fairly simple and a playthrough only takes about an hour, but they’re fun for what they are. If this game’s price seems scary to you, you can always try the first game for free and see if its gameplay style is right for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157541327', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1628243891}
review:
I did not expect to enjoy this game. Especially since I'm not the biggest bullet hell fan. But it really surprised me!

Some of the characters are written really well (like Argutatrix), while others are just hilarious! Plus, being able to date [b] all [/b] of the characters, and having myriad of ablities depending on you significant other is a fantastic idea!
I usually don't like to fully complete games, and never in one sitting, but I got to 101% with this one, and it was fun all the way. [spoiler] Though, it is pretty annoying that the 102% is permanently locked unless you knew about it in advance. [/spoiler]

It was a short game, but I enjoyed every second of it!

review: Level/world design is a mess and writing in my opinion got worse. I remember in the original game almost every character has something corky, interesting or funny. And original game was free. Only thing that catch my attention is bosses and new system with variable special attack. In comparison to original only thing that was improoved is difficulty. Normal now gives you some challenge and gameplay doesen't feel boring. So I don't even forced to play hard like in original game to get something challenging out of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042344548', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1619377989}
review:
Solitamente non mi aspetto molto dai prodotti ricevuti gratuitamente, specie se si tratta di titoli indie, eppure questo Princess Remedy mi ha piacevolmente stupito: la grafica e i suoni sono retro e ricercati, sicuramente possono non piacere ma credo che siano un plus per chiunque sia attratto dal retrogaming e da certi suoi aspetti in particolare.
Il gioco in sé è un semplice bullet hell, non esageratamente difficile come altri sul mercato, ma abbastanza impegnativo da far passare una bella serata o un pomeriggio di gioco, senza eccessivo stress.
Una run completa richiede circa 2 ore, ma naturalmente il gioco si presta a speedrun e sfide di altro tipo che possono intrattenere anche per decine di ore. Purtroppo non sono attratto da questo tipo di rigiocabilità, ma a chiunque lo fosse consiglio assolutamente questo gioco.
In conclusione, è difficile dare un giudizio ad un prodotto tanto di nicchia, ma mi sento comunque di consigliarlo a chiunque ne fosse anche solo attratto o incuriosito.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991393882', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1619216694}

review:
this game has the same attributes as it's [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/xdjx19/recommended/407900/]predecessor[/url], with some mild changes like more boss fights and dating certain partners for different specials. 

but only real downside with the first game has become an issue as this game comes with a price tag. this game is still a 1-2 hours long, but without any graphically or story driven changes. the price for this game is also overpriced as all hell - to the point that even when it's 50% off, it's still absurdly high.

it's wise to hunt elsewhere.

review:
这画面让我想起了小时候的黑白Game Boy~oh~买不起彩色机器~所以~emmmm~
画面和界面简直不要太像~和GBC的风格简直一模一样~
但GBC时代游戏的玩法还没这么好~大多是你打我一下我打你一下的RPG~

~但这游戏战斗是射击模式~
主角基本就是通过治疗路上的各种各样的角色，来让角色加入自己队伍~
加入的角色会用自己的能力来辅助主角~比如治疗，射击，丢炸弹等等~

最后·····没最后了~我这种是完全通不了关的~

author: {'steamid': '76561198103916275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1608572651}
review:
[h1]Das kommerzielle Prequel eines Überraschungshits[/h1]
Das kostenlose „Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt“ entpuppte sich als Überraschungshit auf Steam. Was liegt da also näher, als einen zweiten Teil zu produzieren, der zwar etwas umfangreicher ausfällt, dafür aber auch kostenpflichtig ist? So oder so ähnlich dürfte wohl der Gedankengang vom schwedischen Indie-Entwickler Ludosity ausgesehen haben. Also kreierte man ein Prequel mit den Namen Princess Remedy in a Heap of Trouble und veröffentlichte dieses am 09.09.2016 auf Steam, wo es aktuell für 3,99 Euro zu erwerben ist. Ob das Spielkonzept in seiner kommerziellen Form immer noch überzeugen kann oder nicht, erfahrt ihr im folgendem Test.


[h1]Zerplatzter Urlaub[/h1]
Wie bereits geklärt, handelt es sich um ein Prequel. Die Handlung spielt also vor den Ereignissen des ersten Teils: Eigentlich befand sich Prinzessin Remedy, ihres Zeichen Heiler-Azubine, im Urlaub. Dummerweise brachen zwischenzeitlich in der Nachbarregion der Heiler-Akademie, dem sogenannten „Boss Tower,“ mehrere seltsame Krankheiten aus. Also wurde Remedy von ihrem Lehrer Wash-Olof zurückbeordert, um die Bewohner des Boss Towers zu heilen sowie den Ursprung der Krankheiten zu ermitteln und zu beseitigen.

Und mehr gibt es dazu auch nicht zu sagen. Die Handlung dient nun wirklich nur noch als Mittel zum Zweck, um ein weiteres Spiel raushauen zu können. Aber das haben Prequels ja nun einmal so an sich.
Nichtsdestotrotz wurde der Schrifttext im Spiel wieder sehr charmant und amüsant verfasst. Die Krankheiten sind so bekloppt wie eh und je, und statt einer Hochzeit gibt es zum Schluss nun ein Tanzdate auf einem Ball – Tanz-Minigame inklusive. Ehrensache, dass man sich seinen Tanzpartner wieder aus allen im Spiel auftauchenden NPCs aussuchen darf und jeder von denen seine eigene Tanz-Melodie mitbringt. Besagtes Tanzspiel ist im Stil von „Dance Dance Revolution“ gehalten und variiert, je nach Tanzpartner von leicht bis brechend schwer. Das Tanz-Minigame ist jedoch ein reiner Bonus und greift nicht in die Endwertung ein. Ungeschickte Spieler brauchen sich diesbezüglich also keine Sorgen machen.


[h1]Jetzt auch mit Dating-Partnern und mehreren Bosskämpfen[/h1]
Die groben Spielschemata haben sich seit Teil 1 nicht geändert. Es ist eine unterhaltsame Verschmelzung aus Erkundung und Kampf, RPG-Elementen und Shoot'em Up. Das Spiel wird aus der Vogelperspektive gesteuert, unterstützt Controller und bietet drei Schwierigkeitsgrade sowie Speicherslots.
Der Umfang wurde seit dem Vorgänger angehoben und bietet nun ca. die doppelte Spieldauer bei gründlicher Spielweise (also ca. 90 Minuten).

Details zum allgemeinen Gameplay findet ihr in meinem Review zu „Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt.“ An dieser Stelle möchte ich nur auf die Änderungen und Neuerungen eingehen, da die beiden Spiele ansonsten identisch funktionieren: So wurde der Statistikwert „Regen“ gegen „Drain“ ausgetauscht. Soll heißen, dass Remedys Lebenspunkte nicht mehr automatisch regenerieren, sondern nur noch, indem man Gegnern Schaden zufügt. Die altbekannten Herzbarrieren, welche erst passiert werden dürfen, wenn man genügend Lebenspunkte angehäuft hat, offenbaren nun Bosskämpfe die zu bewältigen sind, wenn man in das neue Gebiet vorstoßen möchte. Die Bosskämpfe sind dabei erfreulich abwechslungsreich und halten eine gute Balance aus ansteigendem Schwierigkeitsgrad. Lediglich der reguläre Endkampf ist mehr oder weniger eine Kopie des Endkampfes aus Teil 1. Da hätte man vielleicht etwas mehr Kreativität erwartet. Aber als Ersatz gibt es ja noch einen versteckten Bonus-Endgegner.;)

Die größte neue Attraktion ist jedoch das Dating-System. Ihr könnt jeden NPC im Spiel daten, sofern dieser gesund ist. Das bedeutet im Klartext, dass er euch begleitet und Remedys Zweitwaffe, die altbekannte Flask-Granate, gegen seine eigene Spezialfähigkeit ersetzt. Diese Fähigkeiten können entweder Variationen der Flask-Granate sein, oder spezielle Funktionen für den automatisch feuernden Standard-Schuss, wie etwa Schnellfeuer oder zielsuchende Projektile. Oder wie wärs mit einer geringfügigen Heilung oder einer schnelleren Laufgeschwindigkeit? Ein gewisser Teil des Spielspaßes liegt also darin, mit diesen Zweitwaffen-Variationen und Sonderfunktionen herumzuexperimentieren und zu gucken, was einem am meisten nutzt. Wer darauf keinen Bock hat, kann das Dating-System jedoch auch komplett ignorieren und bei der altbekannten Flask-Granate bleiben. Dieses neue Feature schießt Puristen also keineswegs in die Quere. Da können sich andere Fortsetzung eine Scheibe abschneiden.


[h1]Remedys geheimer Egoshooter-Trip[/h1]
Etwas, was man nur mitbekommt, wenn man sich im Steam-Forum umschaut (oder dieses Review liest), ist das versteckte Bonus-Spiel „REALLYDAD.“ Dieses aktiviert ihr, in der Schwierigkeitsgrad-Auswahl, wo ihr mehrere Sekunden lang die Rechts-Taste gedrückt halten müsst, bevor dieser Spielmodus offengelegt wird.
Hierbei handelt es sich um einen sehr primitiven Egoshooter, der sich ziemlich mies spielt, da er, wie auch das reguläre Spiel, kein Strafing erlaubt. Während das im regulären Spiel verschmerzbar ist, da dieses um diese Beschränkung aufgebaut wurde, passt diese Einschränkung zu einem Egoshooter freilich hinten und vorne nicht. Man sollte also kein Spiel erwarten, das Spaß macht. Ein cooles Kuriosum ist REALLYDAD aber dennoch.

Die Handlung fungiert zum Beispiel als Prequel zu „in a Heap in Trouble.“ Eine Krankheitswelle ist in der Heiler-Akademie ausgebrochen. Remedy macht sich auf ihre Mitschüler zu heilen und die Quelle der Krankheiten zu beseitigen. Nach getaner Arbeit bekommt sie von ihrer Mutter, der Königin, eine Urlaubsreise geschenkt.
Der Egoshooter verwendet dieselben Gameplay-Bausteine wie das Primärspiel, weswegen ich nicht weiter darauf eingehen werde. Geändert wurden im Grunde genommen nur die Perspektive und die Manövrierbarkeit der Spielfigur, die hier auch rückwärts laufen kann. Dennoch fühlt sich Remedys Beweglichkeit nicht gut an und die Egoperspektive kostet natürlich auch den Großteil der Übersicht, was den Shooter nicht unbedingt leichter macht. Einen Dating-Parter kann man auch nicht wählen. Netterweise ist REALLYDAD vorbei ehe es zu sehr auf die Nerven geht. Im Endeffekt ist es halt nur ein kleiner cooler Bonus.


[h1]Grafik und Sound[/h1]
Grafisch hat sich seit dem letzten Teil nichts geändert. Auch hier wird der Stil alter ZX Spectrum Heimcomputer-Spiele emuliert. Es gibt also nur eine sehr limitierte Farbpalette vor schwarzem Hintergrund. Es ist ein minimalistischer, aber charmanter Grafikstil, der jedoch bei den meisten Retro-Gamern keine nostalgischen Gefühle wecken dürfte, da der ZX Spectrum außerhalb Englands einfach kein großes Thema war. Dennoch kann dieser Grafikstil gefallen, wenn man sich darauf einlässt. Witzigerweise wurde die Grafik auch recht ordentlich in den Bonus-Egoshooter übertragen.

Beim Soundtrack gibt es wieder nichts zu meckern. Die Tracks fangen den Charme gefälliger 8-bit-Melodien mühelos ein und die Soundeffekte passen ebenfalls. Wer die Akustik des ersten Teils mochte, wird auch hier gut bedient.


[h1]Pro und Kontra:[/h1]

Pro:
- geniale Verschmelzung von Shmup und RPG-Elementen
- ist extrem charmant
- toller Retro-OST
- sinnvolle Erweiterungen des Spielprinzips
- verstecktes FPS-Bonusspiel

Kontra:
- ist ein kommerzielles Spiel, der Umfang wirkt für 3,99 € vielleicht etwas gering
- es ist nur eine Prequel-Story, die den Charme des ersten Teils nicht erreicht
- keine Strafing-Funktion


[h1]Immer noch sehr charmant und spaßig![/h1]
Wer den ersten, kostenlosen Teil mochte, immer noch bock aufs Spielprinzip hat und die Entwickler obendrein finanziell unterstützen möchte, für den führt kein Weg an Princess Remedy in a Heap of Trouble vorbei. Das Spielprinzip ist zwar dasselbe wie in Teil 1, wurde jedoch mit sinnvollen Erweiterungen bereichert, die den hohen Spielspaß auch unangetastet lassen. Beinhaltet auch ein FPS-Bonus-Spielchen.

review:
(8/10)

A cute ultra retro shooter with some good chip tunes and a sense of humor.  It doesn't have a huge amount of longevity but its fun while it lasts and is a worthy sequel to the original princess remedy game and worth your time to take a peek.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013504903', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1605827030}
review:
5 dollars is too much for such a short game, even one that is this fun. You'd gain more content getting Cthulhu Save the World for less money than you would getting this. If you played the (free) first game, this game offers so little in terms of new that it's somewhat insulting. I expected a lot more for the price and was disappointed when I found out it was just as short.

It's a fun game, still. But not worth more than 2 dollars at most. Wait for a 50% or more sale or just skip out altogether. Other than changing your flask to another ability through dating or having a button to walk now, and more than one boss, this game is the same thing as the first. The first even has better music. I wish I didn't have to rag on this game so much but I truly expected so much more for the 5 dollar price tag.

review:
It's good. Better than the original, which I could barely play because it was incredibly blurry. Thankfully this one isn't in GameMaker and is in Unity instead, so it isn't AIDS to play.

Same gameplay as the first, just a little refined and overall better. Recommend playing on Hard for your first playthrough, though. Literally just taking Frallan and smashing your skull into enemies while constantly healing is overly effective on Normal difficulty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198812444124', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1603302744}
review:
recently a formal educand
formally a recent graduate
technically royal initiate
dutifully dissecting ailment

sitting long listening to the matter
dashing on speaking with the sadder
doing her best tracing the patterns
here at last the princess from saturn

tossing her faith to those lost in fear
brought bandages to hold back the tears
searching waste lain there to where for
frogs or flowers to save to follow her

never will she wait for you to ask
to relieve your pains her only task
and to be her date will come to pass
her hearts contained in a broken flask

so as the world turns to an enemy
when your world burns in agony
with all the patience and levity
turn to the girl with the remedy

author: {'steamid': '76561198237416816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1599786893}
review: Quando eu joguei o primeiro jogo, eu realmente torci para que tivesse uma continuação e aqui está. É um ótimo jogo, com uma dificuldade bem equilibrada. Não segue o padrão "Quanto mais upgrade você pega, mais simples ficarão os chefes." Você melhora seus itens justamente para limpar trocentos inimigos que aparecem nos chefes. hahaha A música continua simples porém é qualidade pura. Compre agora, não espere promoção. 10 reais é realmente o preço certo para esse jogo! Ele é curto, simples e desafiador.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096663928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 427, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1568477161}
review:
Серия самых коротких рецензий:

Нормальная

P.S.: Расшифровка:

Трэш — знакомиться с игрой рекомендуется исключительно тем, кто в диком восторге от описания, скриншотов и продолжительности. Остальным, из контакта с этой игрой, только тыкать палкой, как какашку на дороге.
 
Так себе — в основном, эта игра предлагает меньше, чем вы увидите из описания и скриншотов. Рекомендуется только тем, кому вышеперечисленные критерии окажутся «зашибись».

Нормальная — неплохая игра своего жанра. Сами судите по описанию, скриншотам и продолжительность. Игра, примерно, соответствует своему наполнению. 
 
Хорошая — весьма неплохой представитель своего жанра. Многие могут найти тут «свой шедевр». Зачастую, игра приятно соответствует своему описанию и скриншотам.

Отличная — эти игры, зачастую, превосходят свои первые впечатления, основанные на описании и скриншотах (в расчёт не берём репутацию, ибо «тот кто знает, тот поймёт»). Хорошие представители своего жанра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155682375', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1595469391}
review:
Princess Remedy In A Heap of Trouble is the second Princess Remedy game, and my favourite of the two.  The game retains the same cute retro style as the previous game, bullet hell gameplay and witty writing, but expands upon it through the addition of the dating mechanic.  The dating in the game doesn't transform it into some visual novel or anything, it's purely a power-up mechanic.

While I prefer this game over the first game, I would start with World of Hurt to see whether you would enjoy this game or not, seeing as this game actually costs money.  As of now though, we are yet to see a third game, though she appears throughout other Ludosity games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044270955', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 450, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1658862051}
review:
Princess Remedy 2 deserves to be played, the whole western RPG era is upon us, and with the spur of Undertale taking up what could be described as the Final Fantasy of the WRPG genre, this game is like the "Tales of" series. It should be well loved, it has all the makings to be both difficult and fun, but why is it now that the SNES level of loveable games are coming out all of a sudden?
It's a conspiracy, Capitalism is upon us comrades, we must rise up and overthrow the bourgeoisie.
Sure it's 5 dollars, and the music is crisp and amazing, BUT THEY DON'T EVEN ALLOW YOU TO BUY THE ALBUM.
And that my friends is why all consumption within capitalism is unethical.
Wait... you wanna know what the game is like?
It's a typical ATLAS game, bullet hell, with RPG like leveling up.
More games like this deserve to be made, and an increase in the WRPG genre would be nice
Death difficulty makes this game extremely infuriating. 
But not as infuriating as the phrase "Spaghetti Tacos."
I'm going to go drown my sorrows in my sorrows.

TL;DR: Play the game and stop reading my insane reviews.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128239804', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1593372037}
review:
Princess Remedy In a Heap of Trouble sigue las mismas premisas que su antecesor. Estética retro, estilo Spectrum, mapeados estilo Zelda sin enemigos, y los combates contra virus al intentar curar a cada habitante enfermo que encontremos. La banda sonora, sin ser brillante, está bastante conseguida.
La verdad es que se han añadido algunas mejoras con respecto al primer título de la saga, como conseguir habilidades con la ayuda de otros personajes, una media hora más de duración que su antecesor y batallas contra enemigos al final de cada nivel. Sin embargo, estas mejoras son mínimas y no pueden justificar los casi tres euros que cuesta su compra. Quizás, técnicamente, merecería una puntuación ligeramente mayor al primer título de la saga, pero no justifica su diferencia de precio, por lo que merece tener exactamente la misma nota.

NOTA: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198059361840', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 1031, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1593049200}
review:
I was sceptical about the first game of this series. But in the end, it was really fun and I enjoyed the 30 minutes gameplay. That’s why I decided to play the second part two.

This one amuses you for about an hour. The gameplay is quite simple and like old Atari games. Shoot the enemies and try not to get hit. You can upgrade your weapons by advancing in the story and opening crates.

The graphics are bad, but I that makes the game’s charm.

All in all, a short but nice time killer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198359687372', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1588831748}
review: Retro yapısı ve basit hikayesiyle kendisine bir şans verilmesi gereken zaman geçirmelik güzel bir oyun. Sağlık okulundan yola çıkan Remedy karakterinin hikayesini anlatan, yolda karşılaştığını canlı, cansız tüm varlıklara yardım edip onları iyileştirmeye onların absürt hikayelerini okuyup keyif almaya ve Prince Ess adlı karaktere ulaşma hedefini anlatan güzel bir oyun. Müziği ve retro yapısından mütevellit çok hoş bir oyun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982225800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 319, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1588382980}
review:
I started playing this very soon after finishing the first game, which I really enjoyed and thought had just the right length.

I guess too soon, perhaps, because this series' formula has kind of overstayed its welcome for me. It's mostly more of exactly the same as the first game, with some nice additions like regular boss fights (which are quite challenging!), but also weird mechanics like the dating system, which don't really change the game in any meaningful ways.

It's better than the first game, but I've overdosed and don't really want to play it anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026068022', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1585256466}
review:
This "sequel" to a free previous game chose to double-down on its, let's just call it, "playful" tone and, rather bafflingly, bestowed a perfectly generic "companionship" mechanic [spoiler](where you offer/accept certain NPCs to accompany you on your adventures with them providing buffs to certain stats)[/spoiler] with a title of "date". Gameplay-wise it has absolutely no impact on said mechanic and no reason for its existence, other than just to offer you a background token opportunity to act like a heartless harlot and change your "partners" like gloves for your personal benefits, consequence-free.

This leaves a bad aftertaste and, call me old-fashioned, but I'd rather not see so much focus on possibilities of promiscuous, omnisexual and/or interspecies relationships in a retropixel cartoon'ish game.

Stick to the first one, since this is literally nothing, but more of the same (maybe even a bit too much of it)
https://store.steampowered.com/app/407900/Princess_Remedy_in_a_World_of_Hurt/

author: {'steamid': '76561198277648233', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1590202950}

review:

review: I thought the issue I have with this game was familiar! Years ago I tried one of this developer's other games and both have the same problem. My controllers are not recognized by this game. I can't map new controls and the default controls are terrible. Not just subjectively terrible, but hitting right on the dpad moves down and down goes up. Left and up do nothing as far as I can tell. It's just unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280481634', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1584101872}
review:
游戏是好游戏，单个boss死了没保存也就罢了，最后一关实属恶心人，一连串boss，打到最后一个死了又得重来。建议有耐性的朋友入手。
通关了，最后一关建议找那个花的伙伴，因为这样放了技能后，躲避攻击的同时也能打到boss，而且技能要省着用。。。
哦，对了，这游戏相当考验手速，没单身个十几年，哈哈开玩笑的。:-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074129131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1581832311}
review:
RPGっぽいスクロールなしのシューティングゲーム
画像を見たときは「えー」と思ったが、プレイしてみると意外と面白い。だいたい1時間位ですべて終わる。
英語は読んでいないけど、そこかしこにいる怪我や病気をした人を治して（ウィルスを退治して？）行く話っぽい。
治した人はそれぞれアビリティを持っていて仲間にするうとシューティング中に何度か使用できる。
アビリティはいまいち使いづらく爽快感がないが、ヒールがあればなんとかなる感じ。
壁にxの印があるところは通り抜けられるので宝箱を探すのは要確認です。

author: {'steamid': '76561198416188624', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 499, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1581356448}
review:
Fun short game for one evening.

+ Great soundtrack.
+ Simple, yet fun gameplay.
+ Full of secrets. World is full of hidden powerups. There also a lot of other secrets like secret difficulty, secret boss and a bunch of other cool secrets.
+ Great replayability.
+ Graphics, "they suck", the artstyle is similar to undertale's but I like this one a lot more. It features a huge environment variety, but all in poor quality if I can describe it that way. Still, game looks beautiful.
+ Improves over the first game with having a better replayability and much much more powers you can use in combat (First game had only one power, this game has atleast 15)

- Can be annoying if you want to date a character with a certain powerup and you forget which character had which powerup.
- Really needs Steam Achievements.


7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198394732752', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156, 'last_played': 1580799684}
review: If you liked the first one, you'll like this, too; it's mostly more of the same, but given how short the first one was, that's not a problem at all.  The place you'll go are new, of course, and there are tons of new enemies to keep you alert.  The biggest new thing is the dating mechanic, which allows you to date anyone and anything, so long as it can talk.  Different boy/girl/whateverfriends will replace your flask with different powers, like healing, screen clearing, etc.  It's a lovely way to spend an hour or two.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033910034', 'num_games_owned': 3900, 'num_reviews': 555, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1579972662}
review:
Recommended if you enjoyed the free part one,  [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/407900/Princess_Remedy_in_a_World_of_Hurt/]Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt[/url].

This was a short, but fun little retro experience. The graphics and audio are fitting for the old school style, but may not be for everyone. The gameplay is the big winner here though. Combat is done as a run and gun/bullet hell style pixel shooter. No two encounters are the same which is awesome and there are some interesting boss battles too. The story is simple and the actual play time is about 40 - 50 minutes, so might want to wait for it to go on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004569928', 'num_games_owned': 963, 'num_reviews': 282, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 223, 'last_played': 1577686587}
review: Do yourself a favor and think again before selecting Death mode. Just finished it, and wow I wish I had selected Hard mode at the start. Or at least, I really wish they had a difficulty option without having to create a new save file. It's not unfair, but hard would have definitely been more my speed. Anyways, yeah, it's another Princess Remedy game! I really enjoyed the dating mechanic this time around, but I was a bit bummed out to find that the open-endedness and convenience (warp room) of the first game wasn't a thing this time around. There are still life gates, but there's no actual options here. Just heal every person you can in the new area, then move to the next area. In the previous you could heal a bunch and then maybe even skip an area, which was fun. Good adventure, just *very* derivative of the first game aside from the new dating mechanic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258932575', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1577598495}
review:
I would easily recommend this to EVERYONE. I'm saying this as someone who despises JRPGs. I've tried several of them, and have only completed Terry Cavanagh's Hero's Quest (it's less than ten minutes). That being said, I haven't tried that really popular one yet...

It's the perfect length, it's packed with silly dialogue, and most of all, there's a whale with wheels—my the species of one of my fursonae! I would kiss this game if I could.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088230290', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1577283747}
review: In this game, you travel from location to location, curing the inflicted by battling strange objects in a shoot-em-up / bullet hell style of game-play. It starts off easy, but becomes increasingly more difficult as the game progresses. You can "date" the creatures you cure, who will then follow you on your journey and offer special bonuses in battle. It's short, but fun. I finished it in 78 minutes at 93%. I liked the dark humor. I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208370897', 'num_games_owned': 420, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1576674624}
review:
[h1]It's a nice game for one night.[/h1]

Princess Remedy 2: In A Heap of Trouble is a game in which our goal is to treat people we meet along the way, and even doors(yes, doors). We treat them by killing the viruses they have in their bodies.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]

8-bit graphics can be enjoyed by many older players. I also liked it, although in some places the characters were similar in color to the surroundings and it was hard to notice them.

[h1]Sound[/h1]

The music is also 8-bit and adapts to the situation on the screen. It's different when we're exploring the map, and different when we're fighting.

[h1]Summary[/h1]
In general, the game is cool, but it has a few drawbacks like the dating system with the characters we meet. Theoretically, they should give us additional skills during the fight, but I don't think that's the case.
[b]
✔️Short
✔️Music
✔️Graphics

❌Unfinished dating system
❌Monotonous

[i]Time of completion:  1-2 hours[/i]

[b][u]Rating: 5/10[/u][/b]

[i][h1][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34408584/]Follow my curator for more reviews[/url][/h1][/i][b]
ATTENTION!
Please note that this is only my evaluation and opinion of the game. If you do not agree with it or think that the game deserves a higher or lower rating, please leave a comment and I will be happy to respond.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197972040704', 'num_games_owned': 1844, 'num_reviews': 725, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1571034564}
review: I thought I wanted more Princess Remedy after the first game...and I did, but not this much. Much like with Evoland 1 and Evoland 2, "less is more," at least as far as I'm concerned. In retrospect, the sheer brevity of Princess Remedy is what I think I loved most about it. Its sequel, however, I've yet to complete, and I'm already growing bored of it. If this genre is something you can't get enough of, then Princess Remedy 2 might be your absolute dream game, but if the genre isn't normally your thing and the first game was a nice dash of delight that left you satisfied but not outright craving more, then it might be best to skip this game. I think the game seems to be made just fine and has more effort put into it than the first one did; especially as far as boss battles are concerned. However, that majestic brevity of the original game that I loved so much was sadly not here.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995424564', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1605545446}
review:
"Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt" et "Princess Remedy 2: In A Heap of Trouble" sont deux jeux indépendants adorables nés originellement d'une "game jam" (concours où l'on doit créer un jeu en très peu de temps), et qui recoupent plusieurs tendances rétro: leurs graphismes en pixel art rendent hommage au ZX Spectrum (sans [i]colour clash,[/i] hélas), leur esthétique et leur univers reprennent les clichés des jeux de rôle japonais, et leur action s'inspire des twin stick shooters à la "[b]Robotron: 2084[/b]". Ce drôle de mélange hétéroclite est de surcroît accompagné d'un délicieux retournement des conventions...

Malgré leur humilité, ces jeux sont pour moi deux bijoux extraordinairement distrayants, qui prouvent que l'on peut créer quelque chose de surprenant, transgressif et novateur à partir de "vieux" concepts des années 1980, même si le premier épisode (gratuit) vaut plus le détour que le second (payant)...

([url=https://simbabbad.blogspot.com/2019/11/princess-remedy-les-deux-jeux-sur-steam.html]suite de cette critique sur mon blog[/url])

author: {'steamid': '76561198149437416', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 589, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1574143011}
review:
Princess Remedy In A Heap of Trouble is a steam videogame featuring...

To celebrate love with a pandora effet box this game is an emotional trip with great writing and just a compelling gameplay driven experience that needs to be played but to display a friendly note reminder this game is really short it can take you less then a hour if your really good or not?

First of all everything swings into the department of a bouquet salami bundle of joy!
The music is a gameboy melody from the tingling soul!
And the controls are just like a gameboy drilling comfort to your closure hands!

I really love the art,the garlicky boss battles with a traditional abstract contrast to them in yielding favor!
The towns aka locations are really cool to explore and the whole dating feature is really dotted into a saucission of magnitude inspired combinations with all kinds of gesture characters to look out for!

THIS GAME IS carnivore heaven its both good or evil whatever u take and decide so i really recommend this game further more and PROPS TO THE developers and the ideas that got from THE HIGH GLOVE GOD higher power because its a short spiced up game that delivers on every frequent note!

I give this game a 10/10 right in tropical EMOTIONAL expressed movement!!!

Also love the DDR ENDING made it worth awhile while playing that dancing minigame love the burrito master!!!

review:
Огромная Башня возникла из-под земли, поднимая с нее целые города. Люди привыкли к этому и продолжали жить на башне, но они начинают болеть всевозможными загадочными болезнями. Принцесса Ремеди, все еще учащаяся в сатурнианской школе исцеления, должна использовать свои силы, чтобы исцелить всех и победить Босса Башни!
5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198086681617', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1601401168}
review:
Estamos ante un juego indie,con estetica retro de la compañia ludosity, creadora del videojuego ittle dew.

La historia del juego es lo de menos, una gigantesca Torre de Jefe ha aparecido de la nada del suelo, arrasando ciudades. Los residentes de esas ciudades se limitaron a seguir viviendo en la torre, pero empezaron a contraer extrañas enfermedades, así que la princesa Remedy debe curarlos a todos y derrotar a la Torre Jefe.

El detalle mas importante es que esta solo en ingles,(aunque tampoco influye mucho), y es basicamente un shooter en el cual te vas cargando enemigos hasta llegar al enemigo final.Su gran ventaja es ir consiguiendo aliados con poderes especiales, y tu decides a quien llevar.

En el aspecto negativo,es que en el modo normal,te llevara 1 hora o como mucho 2h, dependiendo de tu habilidad, eso si ,el rato que juegas es entretenido.

Por 4 euros.no merece  la compra,pero por debajo de 2 euros, se le puede dar una oportunidad.Al conseguirlo gratis por steam, por supuesto lo recomiendo

author: {'steamid': '76561198020674465', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1572276680}
review:
Buen juego Indie, principalmente tendremos que ir pasando unas mazmorras, en las cuales mediante nuestra habilidad habrá que esquivar los ataques enemigos, moviéndonos a la vez que nosotros a su vez les golpeamos hasta acabar con ellos, al terminar cada mazmorras iremos consiguiendo vidas y tendremos la oportunidad de que un personaje nos acompañe (que básicamente es una habilidad, la cual la podremos usar en estas mazmorras, la cual nos dará facilidades para pasar estas).

Básicamente este es el juego, sencillo, pero divertido, ya que cada vez ira subiendo en dificultad, aparte de esto, tendremos que ir investigando, ya que hay determinados secretos, e iremos hablando con estos personajes y conociendo más acerca de la historia, que básicamente es que hay que salvar al reino, pero cuyas conversaciones con los distintos personajes que nos iremos encontrando, tienen ciertos tintes de humor.

El juego se puede jugar con teclado, pero también con mando, la verdad que se disfruta de los dos modos, el manejo del personaje es sencillo y esta muy bien.

Lo recomiendo si eres un amante de los juegos Indies, o juegos de habilidad tipo Super Meat Boy, este juego tiene un estilo grafico a los juegos de los años 80, de los ordenadores amstrad o commodore antiguos, también recuerda al zelda de nes o los juegos inmediatamente anteriores a este, lo cual te sorprenderá, por que este juego es una demostración más de que un buen juego, para ser bueno, debe ser divertido.

En cuanto a la duración, yo he hecho una marca de 1 hora y 20 tantos minutos y completado al 92 por ciento de secretos, en una duración normal, y por lo que veo, es más o menos la duración media de la mayoría, e incluso menos, por lo tanto lo recomiendo comprar en una oferta, pienso que igual se puede encontrar por 99 céntimos o menos, precio por el cual, si eres un amante de este tipo de juegos, puede ser una buena adquisición para tu biblioteca.

También decirte, que hay una primera parte, la cual es gratuita, y creo que es muy parecida a esta, aunque no la he jugado, por lo tanto, es una buena oportunidad para probar el estilo y si te convence hacerte con esta segunda.

[b] Nota: 6,5/10 [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198241178900', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1572158641}
review:
看着免费无聊打开玩一玩，没想到满满惊喜。
怀旧感瞬间被bgm带出，听时间再长也不会腻，让你想起来小时候打魂斗罗和火焰纹章。
剧情也不错，台词很有意思（不推荐英语零基础的人，虽然不影响打关，但会很乏味）
对语言要求不是很高。不同技能可玩性高
最后boss前有个隐藏最强男友，前提之前不能与任何人dating
总之是一款很棒的消磨时间的小游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198010752029', 'num_games_owned': 1658, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1614653229}

author: {'steamid': '76561198350027075', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1572143876}
review:
Short and sweet, certainly one of Ludosity's best games. For the most part, it's the same as the first game, but with a great dating mechanic to allow you to use different abilities. 
Most of the game's value comes from its unique combat system and its sense of humor, so don't come in expecting a groundbreaking RPG title or anything like that. There's a good few secrets and some level of replayability, depending on how entertaining you find the boss battle quotes programmed into every NPC. Definitely worth playing, especially if you enjoyed the first game (it's free!) or any of Ludosity's other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198796851430', 'num_games_owned': 927, 'num_reviews': 3722, 'playtime_forever': 7967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1597504908}
review:
首先游戏的剧情设定虽然看似有趣，但实际展开却显得平淡无奇。故事围绕公主Remedy解决一系列麻烦展开，但剧情的推进和转折都显得过于生硬和突兀，让人难以沉浸其中。角色之间的对话也显得机械而单调，缺乏深度和情感。

其次游戏的画面表现并不尽如人意。虽然游戏采用了卡通风格的画面设计，但整体效果却显得粗糙和缺乏细节。场景和角色的建模都显得简单，缺乏层次感和立体感。同时游戏中的光影效果和色彩搭配也显得平淡，无法给玩家带来视觉上的享受。

在音效方面游戏同样存在问题。背景音乐单调乏味，缺乏变化，无法为游戏增添氛围。而角色配音则显得生硬和不自然，让人难以代入角色。

更糟糕的是游戏的操作体验相当糟糕。角色的移动和动作反应迟钝，经常出现卡顿和延迟的情况。这使得玩家在解决麻烦和进行任务时感到非常不便，大大降低了游戏的可玩性。

此外游戏中的谜题和挑战设计也缺乏新意。大部分谜题过于简单，缺乏挑战性，而一些看似复杂的谜题则显得逻辑混乱，让人难以理解。这种设计使得游戏过程变得单调乏味，难以吸引玩家的兴趣。

最后游戏的稳定性也存在问题。在游戏过程中，我遇到了多次闪退和卡顿的情况，这严重影响了我的游戏体验。

综上所述，在剧情、画面、音效、操作体验以及稳定性等方面都存在明显的问题和不足。虽然它试图通过独特的设定和风格吸引玩家，但实际表现却令人失望。对于期待一款优质冒险解谜游戏的玩家来说，这款游戏可能不是一个好的选择。

author: {'steamid': '76561198024793242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1571866858}
review: I got Princess Remedy 2: In a Heap of Trouble through the limited free promotional package, but I can see any fan of the first game paying money for the sequel. The world navigation feels a little neater in PR2, the unabashed style of humor is poured on heavily, and there is a fun added layer with "dating" different patients to pick up special abilities. There isn't more than an hour of gameplay here, which could be a problem for the game's price point. Pick it up on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198319557946', 'num_games_owned': 86, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1571759302}
review:
This is the sequel to Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt and while it improves on certain gameplay aspects, it still suffers from several major flaws. This game can be played with a controller although keyboard would probably work fine as well since there are only 4 movement buttons and 1 action button required.

Like the first game, Princess Remedy 2 is a retro bullet hell shoot 'em up. You play as Princess Remedy who has to investigate a mysterious Boss Tower which has sprung up and caused the local townfolk to fall ill. To heal the sick NPCs, Princess Remedy enters a bullet hell match where the aim is to kill all the enemies while surviving enemy projectiles. As you win encounters and heal NPCs, you gain increases to your Heart stat which is required to pass locked gates to the next zones. You can also gain stat increases from treasure chests that power up your autofiring weapon. There are 3 difficulty modes, but the game is very difficult even on Normal. In this game, Heart gates are also boss battles which are ridiculously overtuned and are basically damage sponges that offer no interesting mechanics but continuously summon adds that just make the encounter unfair and frustrating.

The new gameplay mechanic is that Princess Remedy can date any NPC she has healed, which basically becomes her partner that follows her around on the field and she can use a special ability during bullet hell encounters. This feature is shallow at best; there are no romance options/scenes and the special ability doesn't do much to help against the insanely difficult boss battles.

There is still no world map, the game doesn't keep track of which NPCs you've healed and the pathguiding to the next objective is nonexistent.

Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this game for anyone looking for a fun gaming experience due to the annoying gameplay, lack of basic features such as objective markers and basic graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381877', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 2587, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1571641952}
review: Princess Remedy 2: In A Heap of Trouble, loved it just like the first one, and i would recommend it to anyone who likes retro graphics or bullet hell gameplay. Couple that with a unique setting and art style that really lets this game stand apart from other similar titles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000637586', 'num_games_owned': 552, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1571615240}
review:
A lovely little game with a simple quasi-retro style, cute aesthetics and amusing flavour texts. It's short but still thoroughly enjoyable beginning-to-end.

Disclaimer: I got this during the "100% off" sale, but after playing it I can say it's well worth the full money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198841255391', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1571465334}
review:
喜加一  1.25h通关
剧情没研究，感觉回到了当初玩儿FC。配合电子音乐海星。
打到40多我才发现按 X 可以用技能，不同伙伴技能不一样。墙上有裂缝的可以跑到地图外。

author: {'steamid': '76561198071165689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 38, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1571438592}
review:
It's pretty obvious this game was not balanced around the hard difficulty.

Specifically, hard wasn't balanced at all.

If you want a sort-of bullet hell game, it's pretty all right, but it won't make you feel like you're playing well. It'll make you feel like you're limited in controls, far too tanky, and you don't do any damage. Don't worry though, you being tanky is made up for by enemy bullets being too big.

Play the first one for a pseudo-bullet hell.

P.S. If you ever want to make a boss that moves around, give it less health than the ones that take up half the screen and are stationary. It's pretty important.

author: {'steamid': '76561198819043139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1571237822}
review:
Fun short game with a couple of cool concepts that stay interesting throughout your play-time. The writing for the many characters you come across is lighthearted and creative, and provides some much needed down time between highly frantic bullet-hells. I sometimes found it difficult to focus on text on the screen (not that the text is in anyway vital).
Boss fights were all pretty good, especially the last boss, each one upped the challenge enough to keep it difficult, but not to a ridiculous extent.
This would be a really awesome game for handheld consoles, with it's pixel style and simple controls. 
Nevertheless, fun game, worth a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970739339', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 564, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1571424157}
review: A prequel to the first game, this installment finds Remedy, still in healing school, on a quest to reach the top of a strange evil tower that is inflicting the strange denizens of Saturn with various illnesses and neuroses. New additions include many more boss fights, and the ability to date any NPC, which in gameplay terms makes them your party member. Which NPC you have following you determines your special attack in combat segments. Otherwise it's a lot like the first one. Short, fun and just a little bit weird.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999747491', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1571344401}
review:
Wer Bullet Hell-Spiele mag, der sollte vielleicht nicht auf mich hören, sondern auf all die positiven Reviews.
Ich mag keine Bullet Hell-Spiele. Und entsprechend langweilig und öde fand ich dieses Spiel.
Und auch der angepriesene Humor hat überhaupt nicht gezündet. Evtl. war das Englisch dazu auch zu kompliziert und abstrakt.
Dazu auch noch eine hakelige Steuerung und dieser in meinen Augen grässliche Grafikstil.
Alles in allem: Nee, das kann ich überhaupt nicht weiterempfehlen.
Aber ich empfehle die anderen Reviews anzuschauen und sich ein differenziertes Bild zu machen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198242318552', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1571187265}
review:
I ADORED Princess Remedy In A World Of Hurt. Unfortunately, this felt like a huge mess of design mishaps and a downgrade from the first game in terms of execution.

In the original game, Remedy's hitbox was her entire sprite. This was straight-forward and didn't cause any confusion. In this sequel, the hitbox is significantly more ambiguous. I'm still not exactly sure what it is, but I assume it's her eyes, since that's where your shots come from. This makes it way harder to tell what's going on when facing upwards, since the character's eyes aren't visible.

The first game had several enemies, each of which all had their own unique pattern of attack and movement. This game keeps many of the same enemies (with adjusted sprites, but they still look mostly the same) but adds enemies that have redundant behaviours. 

Additionally, the first three boss fights rely on additionals (normal enemies just added into the fight) for a sort of artificial difficulty and incorporate too many background sprites. Specifically the third boss is the most egregious offender, where it's initially unclear what is and isn't going to block your path and the screen is visually too busy to tell what's going on thanks to the fast-moving adds that constantly spew bullets and the background elements being generally all-over.

If this were a game where one could control the direction of your shots independent of your movement, the first three bosses having additionals (rather than actually changing attack patterns) would be less of a gripe design wise. Every boss afterwards is an actually fun and interesting boss design both visually and gameplay wise; movement areas aren't unnecessarily cluttered by background sprites and additionals are both more thematically included and feel more organically part of the boss fight.

Even certain areas in the towns and overworlds feel like sprites and colours were used too liberally, the 'limited palette' look from the original game being sort of disregarded to add as many specific colours to certain items just wherever. This is however less of a problem as it doesn't directly affect gameplay, but it still makes certain areas seem weirdly out of place. 

It it nice however to see NPCs such as the girl who thought she was a rock, jealous chest, and a few others return from the first game to this one. 

Overall, this game feels like a let down as a sequel due to some design choices that probably weren't exactly necessary. Aside from the sort-of new enemies that just act like reskins of old ones that are still actually in this game, and some town and overworld designs that provide visual clutter, as well as visually cluttered boss fights.

Overall, if you haven't played "Princess Remedy In A World Of Hurt", you'll probably adore this game for its charm. If you're coming off the coattails of the first game, you'll still absolutely adore this game, since it's just more of the same. But I personally couldn't enjoy this, and found Remedy's first game to be all around better for both gameplay and charm. 

Also, I checked the "Recieved for free" box because I snagged this game while it was 100% off for a short time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198840919905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1571222128}

author: {'steamid': '76561198201326962', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1571203417}
review:
Un Bullet Hell con estética retro, una historia bastante surrealista y personajes y diseño encantadores.
Bastante corto (en cosa de hora y media se termina), pero todos los personajes tienen ruta romántica y final propio (sí, todos), con habilidades variadas, y hay modos de dificultad para todos los gustos (mae mía, el modo DEATH), así que de rejugabilidad no está nada mal.

(Ante la duda de si comprar o no, prueba el primer juego, gratuito. Esta es una secuela con algo más de contenido y mecánicas)

author: {'steamid': '76561198061665641', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 338, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1571163888}
