author: {'steamid': '76561198257379177', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1571293552}
review:
For clarity, this game was free in a recent sale, which was a very neat surprise!

If you enjoyed Princess Remedy in A World of Hurt (which you should definitely try out; it's very fun and completely free), In A Heap of Trouble is basically more of the same: you go around, interacting with NPC's and healing them of their illnesses by shooting said illnesses in top-down shmup segments, where Remedy fires automatically (so you just have to worry about positioning and dodging enemies and obstacles), and you get health upgrades for healing NPCs and a wealth of other upgrades from scattered treasure chests.

The main differences here are

1) This game is a bit longer and progressively gets more difficult than the first game; I died a few times near the end. Thankfully the only penalty for death is being booted back in front of the NPC.

2) Whereas in the first game, you could date any NPC in the epilogue to get unique ending dialogue, here you can start dating any healthy NPC from the get-go. Depending on who you're dating, you will have a different special ability, including faster movement, a backstep, freezing surrounding enemies, and laying down mines, among others, which can give you a good edge in combat. Almost every NPC shares the same ability with several other NPCs, which is a little disappointing, but there is still one primary difference between each NPC; but I'd rather not spoil that little tidbit.

3) The first game had one boss fight at the very end, but this game focuses on having multiple bosses, each one acting as a barrier between areas. Each one is unique, offering interesting visuals and a challenging fight, so these are very much appreciated!

And just so I don't forget to mention these, I adore the well-crafted ZX-Spectrum-style graphics, and the NES-style soundtrack is pretty great too!

Overall I'd say In A Heap of Trouble is basically a direct upgrade of In A World of Hurt, and I enjoyed it quite a bit! My only real complaints are that, like the first game, you can't strafe, which I think could have made the combat even more enjoyable, and while the dialogue from the NPCs is quite humorous, the jokes from the numerous bookshelves, radios, and signs you find in the overworld revolve around the same joke, which gets old quickly. Even then this is still a very fun and great title!

And honestly, the stuff you can do after beating the final boss - stuff I don't want to spoil - is very unexpected and makes this game worth the price in and of itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116482292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1571074633}
review:
【言語】英語
【難易度】普通 (3段階変更可)
【実績・カード】なし
【クリアまで】約1時間+

こちらのゲームは一応続編となりますので、知らない人はまず前作をプレイするのがおすすめです。
しかも前作は無料ゲームなので、まずはどんなゲームなのか遊んでみましょう。
それで気に入れば今作を買うのがいいかと思います。
https://store.steampowered.com/app/407900/Princess_Remedy_in_a_World_of_Hurt/

言語は前作と同じく英語のみ。ストーリーを深く理解するにはある程度英語が読めないといけませんが、英語が分からない人でもゲーム自体はシンプル。前作が大丈夫な人なら今作も大丈夫でしょう。

プレイスタイルは前作と変わりません。ゲームシステムも同じで、病気の人を治して旅するシューティング風RPGです。ただ操作性が良くなっていて、前作は1つのボタンしかなかったので誤動作が多く、会話しようとしたらステータス画面が開いたりしてましたが、今作はボタンが分けられました。

また今作は仲間を1人連れて行くことができ、これが前作の「ボム」扱い。なんと病気を治したキャラクターを誰でも連れて行くことができます。既に仲間がいる場合は、そのキャラと交換になります。
それぞれ違う「アビリティ」を持っていて、前作同様に爆弾をなげるもの、連射速度アップ、ホーミング弾等いろんな種類があります。流石に全キャラが違うアビリティというわけでは無く、被りもありますが・・・面白いシステムです。

あと今作はエリア移動に毎回「中ボス」がいます。そこそこ強いので、前作よりもちょっと難しくなってるかもしれません。クリアできない程では無いと思いますので、前作がクリアできる人なら大丈夫だと思います。

最後にプレイ時間は前作と同様1時間ちょっとなので、あまり変わりません。過度な期待をしては駄目です。前作よりもちょっとパワーアップしている程度です。プレイ時間が短すぎるので定価500円はキツイかも。
本当に前作が好きで欲しい人だけ買うのがいいでしょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198111154003', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1576359278}
review:
To jest dokładnie to czego było mi akurat potrzeba. 8-bitowa oprawa sprawdza się tu wyśmienicie, jest czytelna i prosta w odbiorze. (Co mnie niepokoiło i odstraszało od zakupu tytułu)
Gra to dość prosty shoot-em-up. Na najniższym poziomie trudności ukończenie na 100% zajęło mi 1 godzinę i 3 minuty. Więc jak widać jest to gra na jedno posiedzenie. 
Princes Remedy ma także jedną dość interesującą mechanikę. Mianowicie randkowanie z postaciami w celu zdobycia dodatkowych zdolności w walce. Niby nic specjalnego, ale... w jakiej innej grze możecie randkować z drzwiami?
No i po zabiciu ostatniego bossa jest pewna minigierka, ale nie będę spoilować :P
Powodzenia i miłej zabawy. Grę polecam każdemu

author: {'steamid': '76561198152636284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1570928768}
review:
i really love this game but i think im biased because my name is also remedy 
its a wonderful fun adventure with some good one liners and i like how creative the characters are..
sometimes the text is a little hard to read, but you can just back up a little or make the screen smaller and its fine!
this game especially i feel is a huge upgrade from the experience in the first game. you can experiment with different powers, 
and it seems like there is a lot more writing here. also, the music is fantastic.. i dont remember liking the music so much in the first game, but in this one it really made me excited! i definitely want to listen to it again on my own time.
i really like the idea of this game where you have to heal everything instead of killing it. it really makes you feel like youre leaving a good effect on the world. 
what fun!! this is a great bullet hell game to play!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198824302304', 'num_games_owned': 886, 'num_reviews': 552, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1570912435}
review:
The game is incredibly ugly, half the time I simply can't see the difference between friends, enemies and random obstacles. Or where you can walk and where not. Even if you can't draw, things don't get to look this bad, somebody tried his best on this to make it ugly and succeeded.
The gameplay is ok, but a bit repetitive.
Story is kinda funny, but just not funny enough for a smile now and then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097692628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1572722702}
review:
It's like the first game but better: the music is incredibly nuanced, the enemies are trickier, the graphics went up quite a bit and the new team mechanic gives more possibilites to make a playthrough feel unique and experimental. It also adds a lot of replay value to the game, unless one changes team/date mate after every fight to test out abilities.
Overall, "In a Heap of Trouble" is an expension and partly improvement to a superb first game that didn't take much to win my heart.

10/10 would heal again

review: собственно где мои карточки?

author: {'steamid': '76561198156702647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1570897553}
review:
Game for a specific niche of players. If you're not turned off by it's VERY retro audio-visual style (or if you actually love it, like me), you're a fan of shmups and you enjoy quirky humor you'll enjoy this game, so if you're that kind of player, go for it.

I only have two gripes with it.
1: Too short. I got 94% completion rate on my first playthrough in a bit over an hour.
2: No reason to go back. I don't think there is anything else to do once you beat the game. You don't unlock anything. I have a feeling that every healed character you meet along the way and you decide to bring along to the ending they may have different dialogue lines but... nothing else.

Still, it's great for what it is. Small, but very charming and for people like me who grew up with C64, very nostalgic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003818180', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1599, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1570881293}
review: Princess Remedy 2 is already a modest improvement over the original, but its secret difficulty easily pushes it up into the realm of must-have. I came to this one looking for more adorable shmup action and I got it, with enhancements to the combat and punchier writing than ever. I was not looking for the completely new gameplay of its hidden difficulty and now that I’ve experienced it, I long for another game in the series built entirely around what I’ve seen. Few games hide such wonders deep within a quality experience of its own, but Princess Remedy has the benefit of being built upon a rock-solid foundation of creativity and fun. If you enjoyed the first game you absolutely cannot miss this one, as it does just about everything better and tops it with one of the best surprises you’re liable to get from any game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198878766897', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1571053948}
review:
Итак, начнём с того, что эта часть является приквелом к игре Princess Remedy In a World of Hurt, и принцесса Ремеди только обучается в Школе Лечения, собсна, навыкам лечения. 

Сюжет - 10/10
Насколько я понял, сюжет заключается в том, что вдруг откуда ни возьмись из-под земли выросла Босс Башня (Boss Tower в оригинале), по виду напоминающая дерево, заодно подняв с земли (btw действия игры разворачиваются на Сатурне, лол) все города. Жителям делать нечего - поэтому они и не против особо. Но со временем граждане-обыватели стали замечать, что их народ терроризируют различные болезни, от грусти и печали до вывиха шеи. Помочь всем жителям и, самое главное, Принцу сего Королевства, доверили ученице Сатурнийской школы лечения, принцессе Ремеди. Неплохо.

Геймплей - 9/10
Довольно однообразный bullet hell, но мне нравится :D

Графика - 9/10
8-битный графон мне по душе, поэтому за него ментальный лайкос разработчикам.

Музыкальное сопровождение - 8/10
В каждой локации она разная, что, в принципе, также не дает нам заскучать. Приятные и не надоедливые мелодии :)

Итог 9/10 свиданий с цветочком!
Отличная игра, чтобы провести за ней часок-другой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042227702', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1570862471}
review: As a game it's good, I recommend it. My biggest issue with the first was the difficulty balancing. Having just played through normal on this one, I can say this one feels fine. The biggest issue I can take with this now is how it stands up as a sequel gameplay-wise, because mechanically it plays very similar to the first. Everything else got a new coat of paint: the art (not stylistically), music, story. The dating system feels like it should have addressed exactly that, and to a degree it does, but I wasn't that encouraged to play around with it. There wasn't really ever a moment where I thought I should stop retrying a level to go run back for a different partner for a competitive edge. For me it's also worth noting that the dating amounts to what should be about 4 different lines of flavor text per character per play through. If you were hooked by the idea of the dating, know it's not really that kind of game. That's about it for complaints though. The base game play is still pretty fun, and the new enemies and levels help freshen it up. That combined with everything else being new makes this still pretty solid all around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045370126', 'num_games_owned': 892, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1570865509}
review:
★★★★☆☆

難易度ノーマルで約７０分でクリアー。

ファミコンのタンクを匂わすようなシューティングゲーム。ストアーの紹介絵をぱっと見るとマザー系のＲＰＧかと誤解してしまいましたけど遊ぶとまったく違って面白い。目新しい要素は無いが安定して楽しめるゲームでした。
テクノミュージックも良く、途中のセーブができるのもグッド。弾幕も見やすくストレスを感じさせないからラスボスまで遊べれる。シューティングが苦手なゲーマーでも比較的に遊びやすいと思いました。


こちらは無料でいただきました。ありがとうございます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198282301091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1570835779}
review:
This game holds a charm not too dissimilar from Earthbound, Undertale or LiSA.
With pixel art--that is brilliantly simplistic--holding so much personality within every bit, every character being adorably rendered in single or dual colours that work for each. The environments have that classic theming to each one without them ever becoming how the Mario series is with "forest->ice->desert->volcano" and have a more spooky theme, bird theme, royal theme, etc. It is extremely refreshing.
The gameplay is an brilliant hybrid of a Shmup and a classic JRPG, in the best way I see it as a bare bones deconstruction of the two, all it has are:
-Party mechanics, you can have one other party member with one benefit.
-Stat increases from chests you find throughout the world.
-A single passive ability that drains life upon defeating an enemy.
-Shooting.
And this is all it needs! Overall, an extremely charming game and a perfect example of how in game design less can be a lot more, and how to perfectly ease difficulty up while leaving a player to learn mechanics of their own accord.

Play it!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198264274375', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1562364135}
review:
[h1]Here's what you do:[/h1]
Same as the first game, the world is full of people and things suffering from various ailments. Your job is to heal them all. The main action occurs in a single screen shooter. Your character auto fires the normal attack so you can focus on aiming and strategically using your limited special ability. Outside of combat, you explore towns and dungeons to find people to heal. New to this game is the ability to "date" those you save, each of which gives you one of many possible special abilities.

[h1]What I like:[/h1]
Each person or thing you heal is suffering from a different ailment, often funny ones like lack of self confidence, which you heal somehow so they are confident. Or some guy had his face melted off from an amazing experience he had. You can fix that. 
There are treasure chests scattered and hidden throughout the world which contain permanent stat boosts. Some are located in secret areas.
Depending on who you are on a date with, you will have a different special ability, such as homing shots, placing mines, or instantly dashing toward or away from the enemy, etc. Some of these are better in certain types of battles than others. 

[h1]What I don't like:[/h1]
The game is still only an hour long, like the previous game, but the dating mechanic means you can have different experiences each playthrough if you choose.

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
This game is just as fun as the first. I would recommend this to anyone who simply wants more of the same as the first game, "In A World of Hurt." If you haven't played that one first, go do so before you decide to buy this game.

[h1]Want a more in-depth look? Watch my video review:[/h1]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1802573205

author: {'steamid': '76561198273963849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1560595986}
review:
I'll be honest, I didn't go into this game expecting much. I saw it was a free game and downloaded it, but boy am I glad I did. Though the gameplay is simple it provides a few interesting mechanics to the table, not to mention the depth it goes into. 

First thing's first: what is this game? Princess Remedy 2: In A Heap of Trouble is an rpg with bullet hell elements where you play as a princess who is a doctor, aptly named "Princess Remedy." As Remedy you go to various townsfolk, monsters, and sometimes inanimate objects and they'll tell you what's wrong with them, you're then dropped into a small bullet hell section where you have to defeat all the enemies  on screen to cure your patient, after you've finished curing them you get a quick, cute little dialogue where the person you saved thanks you. 

This is where an interesting mechanic comes in. After curing any, and yes I do mean any person, you have the option to "date" them. Dating a townsfolk makes them follow your character around the map and they give you a buff of sorts, they may range from changing how your weapons work to giving  you more health in the healing segments.

The bosses for this game are strong and fresh and after you beat the game, you may activate a "first person" mode, which sounds bizarre mostly because it is. You play the game in first person and gain access to a hidden boss, along with giving yourself a huge challenge. 

Overall, I do recommend this game. It's surprisingly fleshed out for a free game and is a great sequel to the first one. There's a surprising amount of easter eggs and some fun and quirky characters, not to mention the boss fights which range from pretty easy to ungodly hard depending on how much you decide to complete the game before bosses. This was a quick 2-3 hour game that I was able to beat in one sitting and it gives just enough for you to say to yourself "wow I got all this from a free game?"

review:
it's not worth 5 dollars...way overpriced. The first game was really good and fresh and a great play....worth paying for. This one is more of the same with updated gampelay mechanics...great. The problem is the story hasn't improved at all really. You completely know what to expect story and gameplay wise the entire game....its kinda a letdown knowing all this and how its just a way to kill under 60 minutes in a single sitting without much effort. Although that's my fault for playing on the normal difficulty, play on the harder difficulities i guess? idk....taking more damage won't make it funner.
i'll still give it a thumbs up cause its basically the first game AND this game for 5 dollars.....which.....is more fair? sorta. but even nboth these games together its too expensive at 5 dollars. HOpe there's another game, its a great character and concept and fun! THIS ONE wasn't as fun and was shorter but....u kno still good i hope we get more and this character is in other games like the fighting slap super smash ripoff game so that's really cool

author: {'steamid': '76561198093629870', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1560022374}
review: While Remedy 2 never managed to live up to the charm and originality of the first game for me its still a great way to spend an hour or so (I played on Hard, leave me alone). Pretty much the same game all around except for the dating mechanic, its more like an expansion for people who want more of the first than a sequel. I'm definitely not complaining though, as I fit into that category of people perfectly and I always felt like Remedy 1 was quality enough to have payed for. The art, writing and gameplay are as fun as ever, the only problem being how samey it feels to the original. Also the one and only new mechanic and biggest change in Remedy 2 is the dating mechanic which, while utilized well as a way to shove in more funny dialogue, can otherwise be described and underwhelming at best and completely unnecessary at worst. If you are a real one you stuck with Frallan throughout the entire game like I did anyway. Pretty good, recommended. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031582331', 'num_games_owned': 6781, 'num_reviews': 768, 'playtime_forever': 716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1558150024}
review:
in Princess Remedy you walk around healing people by going into a little walkabout screen where you'll auto shoot projectiles at the offending viruses and once they are all dead you'll be able to move on. unlike the free version here you can change your special attack by who to let tag along with you. this is nice but i'ed rather have a way to fire in another direction other than forward.
this is a nice little game and this may just be me but i find most fights easy or hard and rarely inbetween. i feel its do to the small screen limiting movement and attack space. encounters are easy unless its full of bullets then it goes to far the other way and more so when they remove the area you can move in.
this is a really good starter bullet hell game but i feel a expert would want more though this could be hard enough for them to enjoy. 5.5/10

p.s. if your on the ropes about getting this try the free version first

review: The cute, funny and simple gameplay of Princess Remedy is back! The bosses add a tremendous challenge, and the dating system changing up your special ability adds an extra level of strategy. Not the hardest game in the world, but lots of fun, whether you've played the original or not. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997517073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1552822862}
review: I know there's only two games but I adore this series. Everything's cute. The game is easy to understand and if you're patient, it's easy to finish in less than 90 minutes. The random lifeforms you meet and then cure say funny things. I hope there's more to come!

author: {'steamid': '76561198238644024', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1539435457}

author: {'steamid': '76561197990913342', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1532316192}
review:
The first Princess Remedy was good and Princess Remedy 2 is a quality prequel too. From the start you've got a 1:1 of the first game and then they add on with some slightly more involved towns and maps to explore, the dating system for shaking up how you fight(mostly grenade functions) and the real sell is more stuff to fight and loads of boss fights, which is a great addition as the last boss of PR1 was a highlight of that game. PR2 is more PR and that game is free to demo. You like PR1, you'll like PR2. The graphics aren't the star but they do the job well for the theme, the music is even catchier this time and the gameplay has been improved with the addition of more of it.

Remedy is still a cu2ie and $5 to cover playing PR1 and PR2 and support good devs is a good deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323492050', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1564468317}

author: {'steamid': '76561198805184283', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1544344735}
review:
Вау... Просто... Вау... Серьёзно... Это всё что я могу сказать после игры... Хотя... Я всё-таки напишу подробный обзор :D
Действительно оригинальная история с юмором, душевностью и элементами РПГ. Я играл в первую часть абсолютно бесплатно и она мне понравилась, но я не стал её рекомендовать т.к она была сыра. Однако сейчас я просто восхищён!
Вы играете за принцессу ИСЦЕЛЕНИЕ (Хотя мне больше по душе выражение ХИЛКА) и вы должны исцелить большое колличество самых разных персонажей. Окончив обучение вы начинаете всой путь к замку принца. После исцеления любого персонажа вы можете взять его к себе в команду и... Блин, это просто нереально вам поможет! У каждого персонажа свои способности. Боссы здесь просто ужас! Не в том смысле, что они ужасно сделаны, а в том что они выглядят страшно! А про их сложность я вообще молчу! Это хардкор друзья! А я ведь играл нормальном уровне сложности... Но за что я так полюбил эту игру? Саундтрек... Он настолько прекрасен, что я не могу подобрать слов что бы описать его! Он выполнен в стиле чиптюна (8 бит) и этот жанр так и ласкает мои уши ведь я ценитель классики. Возможно заявление громкое, но я считаю, что он должен быть на одной полке с андертейлом. Это однозначно лучшее во что я когда либо играл! Простите за пропущенные запятае, ошибки и опечатки (если они есть).

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198272025039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1631149233}
review: I completed this game in a single session which is both a testament to how engaging it is and how short it is. Given how much I enjoyed the game and that it's only $5, the length is completely forgivable. Highly recommended

author: {'steamid': '76561198131516091', 'num_games_owned': 2712, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1540217844}
review:
레메디의 치료 활동을 다룬 슈팅게임... 

다시 세상이 병들어 가고 있다는 말을 듣고, 주사기와 탄약을 장착한 레메디가 세상을 구하기 위해 여행을 떠나며, 각지에서 만나는 오만 생명체를 치료해 되살리는 내용을 담고 있는 게임입니다...는 개풀 뜯는 소리고요. 사실 저도 당했습니다. 

트레일러에 나오는 대사들만 보면 이게 또 그럴싸한 스토리라인을 가지고 있는 줄로만 알았습죠. 

그 ... 유명했던 MOTHER 시리즈처럼요. 

근데 아냐. 

아니야. 돌아가.

이 게임에 있는 거라곤, 뭐가 됐든 일단 '치료'하고 본다는 사상을 가진, 나사가 수십 개쯤 빠진 매드 너스 레메디와, 그녀에게 '치료당하는' 몇 만 배는 더 정신나간 괴생명체들이 존재할 뿐이었습니다. 

그 말인즉슨.



사실 스토리라인 그딴 건 없고, 그냥 밑도 끝도 없는 4차원 대사를 하며 지랄유세를 떠는 npc들과 그 NPC들을 '치료'하는 과정만으로 이루어져 있다고 보시면 됩니다. 

(아래의 링크는 참고스샷 및 번역들입니다)
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1410637477
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1523783993
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1523784390

어이를 날려보내는 대사를 하는 npc들의 치료 이전과 이후 반응을 몇 마디 대사로 확인하는 재미(...)가 있고, 그들 중 하나를 잡아다가 묻지도 따지지도 않고 '너, 내 동료가 되라.'로 꼬셔서 데리고 다닐 수 있다는 점이 포인트가 되겠네요.

최종보스는 의외로 쉬운 편이고, 중간보스들이 더 어려운 느낌이었습니다만... 난이도가 올라가면 어찌 될 지는 며느리도 모릅니다.

그리고 마지막은... 리듬게임이니 각오해두세요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097675823', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1540908480}
review:
Princess remedy 2 in a heap of trouble is a twin stick shooter hybrid with rpg, this might be the first game that I don't mind the progressive skill tree at all, for other games I always find that really bad for the gameplay, but here its simple, and there is not tons of menus to worry about, so this is a sequel to a very good game, princess remedy 1, you really are the "good guy" in this game, ok you control a female maybe I should say good gal, so you are curing a lot people that have sentimental problems for the most part for ultimately save the world in the most literal way ever seen, if the graphics don't get your atention that is ok, but personaly I think the artwork is really well made, soundtrack is amazing, and sound effects are the best, I will be always looking for experiences that can be something like a spectrum holobite game, with all the color limitations and sounds that sound like dust falling on the ground, its amazing trying games because somewhere around 1985 1989 this games was real, and old games don't mean bad games, specially princess remedy being a 2015 game for what I remember, well the game is new, using old technology to make a really cool hybrid.

+awesome graphics
+awesome soundtrack
+amazing awesome
+and great gameplay

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198436332532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1538365405}
review:
XboxコンでノーマルでPlay(クリア済)してみたが、なかなか弾除けが難しいシューティング(被弾した時の無敵timeがないので、それを利用したゴリ押しplayもできない)だと感じた。やらないけどハードモードだとどうなるのかな？
治療済みの相手は一人だけ連れて行く事が出来る(随時チェンジ可能)。連れて行く相手によってサブウェポンが変わリます。髪の毛が水色の人をパートナーにしてから戦闘が格段に楽になった(自動追尾ミサイル的な)。
ボリュームは少なめ。基本、シューティングなので英語は読み飛ばしてもOK.
そうそうこのゲーム、弾は自動的に発射されるのに最初気がつかず一生懸命ボタン連打してた。

以下、類似ゲーム
https://store.steampowered.com/app/783180/Fairune_Collection/

author: {'steamid': '76561198072182182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1557003564}
review:
The polyamorous princess of my neon dreams is on the frolic for the [i]first[/i] time in this long-awaited prequel, loving up every lucky guy, girl, and [i]it[/i] she can wrap her sweet li'l arms (yeah . . . arms) around.  On this outing, she can date, then break up with, any sentient in Saturnia, receiving a hyper-handy secondary weapon associated with the current squeeze.  

If you admired the original for its frenetic SHMUP rooms, Eurocomputer ghost-graphics, and wonky humor, I've got one thing to say:  [b]Love makes all things new again![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198058026927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1533699967}
review:
개인평점 : [b]'세일 때 사자'[/b]
*1편은 [b]'무료'[/b]
**굉장히 사랑스럽고 잘 만든 게임이다
***최대 단점 : 영어

-플레이 타임 : 약 1시간 30분 (난이도 쉬움)
-난이도 : 약간 매콤. 쉬움기준 아이들도 플레이 가능. 스테이지별 난이도 상승은 아주 적당하다
-그래픽 : 아타리 그래픽
-사운드 : 맵별로 바뀌는 귀여운 음악
-스토리 : 단순하며 부족함이 없다. 바보같으면서도 빠져들게하는 대사들이 일품
-게임성 : 탄막슈팅. 캐릭터들을 치료해 주면 같이 데이트(!)할 수 있다. 데이트할 시  특수능력 사용 가능. 1편에 비해 훨씬 다채로운 플레이가 가능해진다


****이하 [b]스포일러[/b]


1. 게임을 깨고 나면, [spoiler]the Dead Garden 오른쪽 길이 열린다. 가면 That Guy 라는 추가보스가 있다.[/spoiler]
2. 게임을 깨고 나면, [spoiler]Prince Ess 와 데이트할 수 있다. 그의 능력은 Remover 로 탄들을 삭제해준다.[/spoiler]
3. [spoiler]난이도 선택 창에서 오른쪽 키를 누르고 있으면 숨겨진 난이도가 나온다.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198106312763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1534885866}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018326356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1651187238}
review: A Heap of Trouble does exactly what a good sequel should do.  The game keeps the same single-screen top-down action stage format of the first game (Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt), but now adds the ability to select from over a dozen different sub-weapons via “dating” characters once their stage has been cleared.  These sub weapon choices really allow a player to pick a playstyle that suits them the best, and while it doesn’t make the game easier, it certainly makes it feel better.  Each character has unique and silly dialog when being dated, keeping up with the wry wit of the first game.  Another welcome addition is bosses at the end of each area, providing a longer and more pattern-based bullet challenge compared to the relative random normal stages.  Fans of the first game will certainly love this one as well, and to those that aren’t sure, the first game is free, so why not just try it out?

author: {'steamid': '76561197963358821', 'num_games_owned': 1021, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1533528605}
review:
I enjoyed it.  Beat it at 100% in about an hour and a half, but there are more secrets and stuff I haven't discovered.

It's very much like the first game, except with new music and characters and more boss battles.  There's also a new mechanic where you can "date" a character, and each character gives you a different special attack.

If you haven't played the first game, you should; it's free.  If you like that game, then definitely get this one.

 [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/fragmentalstew/recommended/407900/]Here is a link to my review of the first game.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198162381766', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1531954628}
review:
Se vi è piaciuto il primo, questo secondo capitolo migliora la formula aggiungendo cose come: Fight Boss, Segreti, e la possibilità di reclutare compagni, che danno al colpo speciale di remedy, vari effetti tipo: Colpi a ricerca o fermare i nemici per tot secondi. Lo consiglio solo a chi si è divertito con il primo, questo secondo capitolo è un upgrade migliorativo. ^_^

Invece a chi non è piaciuto il primo, questo secondo capitolo non aiuterà a ricredervi, anche se le migliorie ci sono. ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198034816478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1531780424}
review:
It's a sequel to World of Hurt! It's basically more of the same. Since World of Hurt was free, I don't mind terribly.
If you liked Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt, you'll like Princess Remedy in a Heap of Trouble. If you didn't, you won't. That's pretty much all there is to it.
Remedy is a good game, with some minor annoyances that could mostly be avoided (primarily higher difficulties). It's extremely short, and Remedy doesn't get much development as a character, but the difficulty curve is reasonable (except for one particular boss), there's a few secrets that aren't easy to find but are pretty rewarding (though nothing as exciting as [spoiler]finding Frallan in the first game[/spoiler], and the Jealous Chest challenge is much more manageable this time around. Plus, while it's just as ridiculous, [spoiler]Reallydad mode makes a return, though this time it actually has some gameplay instead of being just a joke.[/spoiler]
Which isn't to say that there isn't one significant improvement! It's not going to change the mind of anyone who didn't like the first game, but this time, instead of only being able to marry people once you've beaten the game, you can date anyone you've helped, whenever you want, and have them follow you around the world and change your flask power. I was [i]thrilled[/i]. One of the major things I wanted improved upon from the first game was the love mechanics, and this game gives me everything I wanted out of them: I can take my love on my journeys, they comment on bosses, they give me a power-up, and I get [spoiler]a minigame at the end with them![/spoiler]
The biggest problem I had with the first game is still present, however: you can only shoot in the direction you're moving. No strafing. This is especially frustrating in certain boss fights where the game limits your movement to a single narrow line, and in Reallydad mode (though that's a joke anyway so I'm not too broken up about that.) There were more than a few times when I had to choose between dodging and attacking, and some enemies do so much damage that that's not really an option. I don't like bullet hells normally and this is particularly frustrating. If the game wasn't so good, this would be more annoying.
As always, I appreciate how much representation this game has. Remmy[spoiler]'s plump thighs[/spoiler] and Frallan is still my OTP.
8/10: better dating sim than most of the dating sims I've played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970314107', 'num_games_owned': 2304, 'num_reviews': 917, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1531462716}
review:
Perhaps the most obvious route for a sequel to take is more of the same, and at first glance that’s just what the second installment of Princess Remedy is. Taking much the same mechanics as the first game and presenting a new world of kooky characters and strange locales, you could be forgiven for thinking this to be a simple continuation, an expansion, of the original. That’s what I thought, even as I began to explore the new mechanics and bosses introduced. By the end it had proven itself its own title, with enough setting it apart to show a real evolution of the series, if a modest one. But plumbing the many secrets of the Heap of Trouble revealed something so striking that it’s almost worth playing through just for that singular experience.

Going the prequel route, Remedy 2 catches up with our favorite little combat medic back in Saturnian healing school. An aptly-named Boss Tower has erupted from the land, sprouting giant tendrils that have lifted parts of the populated world into the sky. It’s also making everyone dreadfully sick, and who better to save the day than a sprightly littel healer? In her quest up the tower, Remedy will encounter all manner of afflicted citizens, collect a variety of powerups, face off against massive bosses, and drag hapless dates along for the ride.

It’s a more interesting setup than the original, with kookier characters and stranger lands to explore. I’ve healed birds with too many thumbs, chronic haters of video game writing, people that don’t exist, and the self-loathing embodiment of hype itself. Traveling the Dragon-Questish lands of opulent Moneyplace, airy Avian Peaks, and the grim Dead Gardens to name a few. The writing and creativity are significantly dialed up here, and complimented with running-gag collectibles to hunt for alongside the many, many hidden treasure chests in the walls of houses and floating in inky voids.

Combat is much the same as before though, a mix of bullet-hell dodging gauntlets of foes and blasting them away with your auto-firing bandaids or syringes. The mechanics have changed in a few places, though, such as the regen stat being swapped for drain which restores your own health as you damage enemies. Flasks also have dozens of different uses now, from screen-clearing clusters and devastating lasers to speed boosts and land mines. Your flask function is determined by who you’re dating at the moment, a new system that feels like a needed expansion of marriage in the first game, allowing you to bring along any NPC in the game as your little love buddy. They also comment on the bosses you face, taking the form of huge, creepy, screen-filling creatures to blast the weak points of. While they’re more engaging than the old heart gates I must admit they make the game feel more like a traditional battling RPG than the unique healing-centric first title.

There are certainly innovations to be found here, if only incremental ones. Starting out A Heap of Trouble didn’t feel hugely different from World of Hurt, though given how good the first one is more of the same is hardly disappointing. I came to appreciate the new dating and combat mechanics more and more as I progressed, and the writing started to get more and more chuckles from me the closer I got to the end. The final boss will be a familiar presence for fans of the original, and I was delighted to find a secret boss afterwards that presented a significant challenge. That gave me a hint to a special hidden difficulty that, honestly, I’m struggling not to spoil for you. It’s one of the most unique surprises I’ve ever seen in a game, and while it is indeed incredibly hard it’s also so different and so fascinating compared to the base game, you absolutely have to see it for yourself… especially if you’re a fan of the obscure classic Faceball 2000.

Princess Remedy 2 is already a modest improvement over the original, but its secret difficulty easily pushes it up into the realm of must-have. I came to this one looking for more adorable shmup action and I got it, with enhancements to the combat and punchier writing than ever. I was not looking for the completely new gameplay of its hidden difficulty and now that I’ve experienced it, I long for another game in the series built entirely around what I’ve seen. Few games hide such wonders deep within a quality experience of its own, but Princess Remedy has the benefit of being built upon a rock-solid foundation of creativity and fun. If you enjoyed the first game you absolutely cannot miss this one, as it does just about everything better and tops it with one of the best surprises you’re liable to get from any game.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/11322459/]curation page[/url]!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025540438', 'num_games_owned': 7104, 'num_reviews': 559, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 191, 'last_played': 1530984801}
review:
A shining example of how to do a sequel, Remedy 2 improves or adds to the original in just about every way.

Gameplay is identical to the first game, but with the addition of the ability to date any of the NPCs you now have a huge host of alternate abilities you can replace your throwable flask with. If you're having trouble with a particular stage then not only do you still have the option to try other stages first to level up a bit, you can now change your flask to something like a piercing laser or a heal and see if the alternate strategies that come with them help you clear the stage.

Another solid balance change is the replacement of the Regen stat with a new feature called "Drain". Rather than a slow health regen on a delay after being hit, you now recover a tidbit of health every time a bullet strikes an enemy. The original Regen function had a tendency to have little to no impact on Remedy's survivability, and this change makes it far more useful.

Enemy variety is even more plentiful than before, with a number of new enemy shot types added to the mix such as shots that will shift direction once to avoid missing you, or shots that leave a hazardous trail behind them. The stages are still balanced excellently and make full use of creative enemy combinations, with redundant "the same enemy as before but with more HP" foes phased out in favor of increasingly varied attack patterns as you progress.

Likewise, the addition of end-of-world bosses is a welcome new feature, with each of them acting as their own unique challenge to cap off each set of stages. On top of being a great way to test the player's progress, they provide you with some really fun setups that couldn't otherwise be accomplished with just regular enemies, acting as that final bit of fleshing out for a wonderfully varied level set.

Upgrade drops have been streamlined, with bosses now being how you get shot power and multishot powerups rather than finding them in random chests, ensuring a smoother difficulty curve compared to the first game. Likewise, secrets have been improved, requiring a keener eye than the previous game and as a result they're actually quite fun to find.

The humor is still spot-on, and on top of a unique ending line per character, every single one of them now has a short Dance Dance Revolution-styled minigame should you pick them to be your date after the final boss. A -unique- DDR minigame per-person, mind you. That's something like 65 songs!

Also, there's a secret 80s FPS mini-campaign that perfectly captures the jankiness of what few shooters we had in that era.

In closing, Remedy 2 does exactly what a sequel should strive for: If something worked the first time, expand on it. If it was lacking something, add it. And if something didn't work so great, tweak or change it until it does. It's improvements and additions more than justify the bump from Free to $5, so if you liked the first game you should absolutely play this as well.

10/10, Bronze Star of just plain being really good

author: {'steamid': '76561198354378792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1531014756}
review: Super cute retro-styled schmup/dating sim?/rpg mix. If you've played the original game, In a World of Hurt, you know exactly what you're getting. Took me just under an hour to beat on the lowest difficulty my first time, though it was a lot of fun and I see myself replaying it a bunch in the future. The dialouge is quirky and enjoyable, and you can "date" people you heal to get powerups in the schmup segments. There's a few boss fights, all of which are really enjoyable, actually, and there's plenty of secrets and reasons to replay the game. Is it worth $5? I personally got it for *50 cents* on sale, which is an absolute steal, so I can't speak for myself, but it's probably worth just waiting for a sale. All love to the developers, they put together an amazing game and this isn't anything against them, but there's a lot of $5 games on Steam with far more depth, and when it goes as low as that for a sale, there's not much reason to buy it at full.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114788467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1528731747}
review:
This is a rpg, bullet hell game. (This game only has the number 2 in the store, but not the library or in the game)
You are Princess Remedy and you have arrived in the Classroom after being called back from your vacation. Wash-Olof tells you about the boss that has arrived in the boss tower and you need to heal people on your way.
This game has some great music, great humor, alot of different endings, different character personalities and a easy bullet hell fighting system.
You need to collect hearts to get to boss battles that stops you from progressing, defeat them and get on with it. There are shortcuts and some hidden places. Durring travels you will also get upgrades that help you and a date system that gives you spesial abilities. Your spesial attacks will be replenished after the fight.
The graphics look like they came out of an really old game, but it is colorfull.
If this sounds like something for you then checkout this hour long inexpensive game then this might fit for you, but you might wanna check out the free (Princess Remedy: In a world of Hurt) before you start this game.
Have fun, enjoy and *praise* the apathetic frog :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197985208745', 'num_games_owned': 1906, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1531164491}
review:
A sequel to a gamejam game I really liked.

If you liked the boss fight at the end of the first game you will probably like this game, it has the healing of the first game as well as the hidden chest to help power you up but now each "Gate" is a boss fight. There is also a new Dating System which allows you to get different powers then your defualt Flask attack from the first game. Not very long, likely an 1 to 1 1/2 hours if you read everything and maybe 45 minutes or less if you rush on easy. There are also to other difficulties to master if you want a longer and more bullet-hellish game. Overall I would recommend this game if you liked the previous entry. If you are not sure becuase of the length definatly get in during a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263316031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 462, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1528459202}

author: {'steamid': '76561198335466110', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1528419476}
review:
It's a continuation of Princess remedy in the world of hurt, which is free so try that out too.
Believe it or not, it's a dating sim, quite enjoyable one at that. 
I do dig the unique experience this game offers. It's very quick, but not really fast paced. You just wonder around until you can do something and move on (while occasionally dating someone at your own will!). Nice soundtrack as always!

If you are looking for short, not necessarily technical and complicated game, this might fulfill that heartful desire.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043782587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 598, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1521458032}
review:
Princess Remedy, a top-down shooter with light jRPG elements inbetween where you expore towns to find them the sweet chests for sweet upgrades. Aside from one chest that sucks. I guess that shooting part is comparable to Robotron 2084, maybe. Or not.

Quirky. Short. Fast-paced. Fun. ZX Spectrum style graphics.

But more of same as the original. Really. It ain't different enough. Seeing how Princess Remedy is an individual with limited social responsibility, she can now date anybody anytime. Well, actually it means you can grab any NPC and thus your Flask powers changes to something else. So there is more variety to gameplay by constantly swapping them. Or you can grab a needed NPC if you have trouble with certain fights. And there are regular bosses. That's all.

So go play the free game first and get this only if you want more of same. I did. Sadly, the magic and charm is not same after the first time. I doubt that the third game would be worth anything without big changes.

Also, secret difficulty is cool. Hold Right at difficulty select. Boom, it's actually a short gimmick FPS. It actually sucks if taken seriously but as a gimmick it's cute.

Also, a running gag in this game sucked. And game sometimes would get stuck at black screen on launch, kinda have to close and try again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073073669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1522596896}
review:
I love the Remedy games.
'In a World of Hurt' is FREE, so go play that. Then, when you're also in love with the world of Remedy come back here and buy 'In a Heap of Trouble' because the dev deserves all of our money and support.

And shame on you if you don't!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018147454', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1515136795}
review: As a fan of the first game(which is free and you should check it out first) I had to support the developers with this one and I'm glad I did. The pixel art is charming and the music is catchy but the writing is where it really shines. There's some really funny dialogue written here. The gameplay is like an auto-shooter and dating characters will grant you certain abilities that will help. It's not the hardest game(if you play on normal) but it's engaging and fun to try out new abilities. My one biggest gripe is the length. On a casual playthrough it took me less then an hour and about 20 minutes on a new game to get the "true" ending. I won't harp on that too much though as it's about the experience and the price point is fair. Overall a great game you should check out if this sort of genre interests you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005647931', 'num_games_owned': 1650, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1518090043}
review:
World of Hurt was already a great arcade-y shooter, but Heap of Trouble improves on it in every way. The bosses are bigger and more fun, the story is sillier, and there's even an awesome surprise gameplay twist at the end. Three bucks for this is one of the best deals on Steam. 

If you haven't played World of Hurt, it's nearly as good and free, so you might as well do that first. If you like it, you'll almost certainly enjoy Heap of Trouble.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168051805', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1604712575}
review:
[h1]É UM BOM JOGO, MAS ESPERE UMA PROMOÇÃO[/h1]

Princess Remedy In a Heap of Trouble é um jogo da série Princess Remedy, recomendo primeiramente você jogar a [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/407900/Princess_Remedy_in_a_World_of_Hurt/] versão free [/url], o gráfico do jogo não é muito bem trabalho, são pixel-arts em poucas cores, a mais predominante é a preta.

O jogo tem uma gameplay interessante, onde é um bullet-hell misturado com estratégia, não sei explicar direito, mas a gameplay é um ponto muito forte. É realmente boa, mas recomendo você jogar para entender o que eu estou falando.

A música do jogo é muito boa de se ouvir, eu pessoalmente gosto muito de músicas chiptune, então caso você goste também recomento comprar o jogo.

Sinceramente acredito que o foco do jogo é a história, pois ele tem bastante diálogos com as personagens, mas na época que eu joguei não sabia falar inglês então não sei te dizer ao certo.
Mas o resumo é que você basicamente é uma mulher que busca salvar as pessoas de doenças, exterminando as doenças dessas pessoas, indo de um lugar ao outro para curar todos os doentes.

Existem vários locais escondidos dentro dos mundo que você entra para curar as pessoas, dentro desses locais escondidos normalmente tem baús com upgrades para o seu personagem.

Pelo fato desse jogo ser leve, eu joguei ele durante uma viagem num notebook então acabou sendo bem útil para matar meu tédio, então é um jogo bem divertido caso não tenha nada melhor para fazer na hora.
O preço dele é bem caro para o jogo na minha opinião, então recomendo esperar uma promoção ou algo do gênero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103185001', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1511737089}
review: Princess Remedy 2 is an interesting blend between a single screen top-down shooter and JRPG with graphics heavily reminiscent of old PC games, notably the ZX Spectrum. If you're not sure whether you'll like this game, I'd recommend trying Princess Remedy In A World of Hurt. It's completely free, and in a way could be seen as a demo of this game. In a way. This game is about as long as Princess Remedy 1. It does have a new 'Dating' mechanic which changes your special attack in battle. This can range from a landmine, flasks like in the first game, a short-range laser, and a larger flask. You can date any NPC in the game. The game also adds a little checkmark when you've 100%ed an overworld area, something the first game would have benefited greatly from. My first playthrough on normal took 53 Minutes, and I 100%ed the game thanks to that feature. When you finish the game, you get a little cutscene with the character you were dating at the time of beating the final boss, similar to the first game. The game is fairly challenging, with higher difficulty levels available for those looking for a harder (Or lesser) challenge, though even a fairly casual player should be able to beat the game on Normal without getting angry. The game relies a lot on humor and charm to sell itself, similar to titles such as Earthbound, and while I can't say I think the humor is as solid as in a game like Earthbound, it's still definitely worth checking out. Simply put, try the free game, and if you like it, support the developers by buying the sequel, it's definitely worth it in my opinion, especially at it's very low price point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013774210', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1506551112}
review:
Très bon petit jeu pour pas chère.
Si vous avez joué au premier Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt, vous ne verrez certes pas grand chose de nouveau si ce n'est les capacités spéciales et les quelques boss fights.

Quelques petits secrets à droite à gauche très sympathiques à découvrir et un véritable challenge pour les amateurs de Bullet hell.
Il faudra vous armer de patience afin de venir à boût du mode de difficulté le plus élevé.

L'humour et le style très "neon retro" font pour moi tout le charme de ce petit jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032632811', 'num_games_owned': 888, 'num_reviews': 758, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1505004009}
review:
A short, pleasant and casual game with personality. A compact experience that’s worth supporting the developer for if you enjoyed the first free game.

Very similar to the original with a few improvements:
-New chiptunes!
-More abilities [gameplay variety]
-More Challenging [maybe?]

I really like how something as simple as auto firing and not being able to strafe meanwhile damage heals you creates a disconnect between getting near enemies and running from them. You can get up close with the multi-spread to do damage or sneak in more healing while also risking your current health. If you’re low, you can try to run but, eventually, you’re going to need to run back in to heal.

Also you can date a door, 10/7 Masterpiece :]

author: {'steamid': '76561197992558863', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1498757620}
review:
This game is essentially the same as the previous game with a well-implemented mechanic that lets you change the function of your bombs. That said, it is still a solid game with tight controls, hilarious dialogue, and a forgiving difficulty curve. My only complaint, perhaps, is that [i]Princess Remedy in a Heap of Trouble[/i] isn't as clever of a pun as [i]Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt[/i].

My suggestion is to play [i]World of Hurt[/i] first (it's free!). If it leaves you craving more, buy [i]Heap of Trouble[/i].

review: Short, simple, and fun! I beat the game on the second hardest difficulty in about 90 minutes. Near the end it hit the sweet spot of just hard enough to be a real challenge without being frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312573931', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1543443513}
review: A fun little game with charming humor, and very reasonably priced (especially if you think of it as paying for the first game, too). The dating system is a nice update. Just a heads up: if you're not great with flashing colors on a dark background, the final boss may give you motion sickness. (But it's worth it, I guess.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198034799250', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1496356717}
review:
I was a person who was really charmed by the original Princess Remedy, which is free and a really cute and nice short game to play.  A bullet hell arena-shooter with very minimalistic gameplay that is nothing but adorable to me. 

This sequel basically gives you more of the same, however it does add a little mechanic that makes it a bit more interesting. Basically Remedy is once again ordered to "heal" the world and has to help people out by curing their illnesses. Goal is to save alot of people and upgrade your stats, like health, projectiles you shoot and their strenght. If you aren't helping people you explore the tiny world in search for chests, which also benefit you. 

The previously mentioned mechanic here is that from the beginning on you can have a companion you can date and switch around as much as you like throughout your journey. Depending on which partner you have, they give you different special abilities during battles. Homing Shots, Speedup, Healing, little Traps and so on, its pretty self explainatory. The game is very fun and battles later on can get quite difficult, which i liked quite a bunch. Never in my short gametime did i feel the game being boring and love its cute style.

If you already liked the first, free game i can recommend this game just aswell. Its a nice extra addition, a quick game to play on the side and cheap aswell. But even if you didn't play the first game, i say give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198214434681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1576280753}
review: I enjoyed the sequel and look forward to more. keep up the good work. Check out the first one too peeps.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997075080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1703260196}
review: An excellent followup to the free first in the series. The gameplay and graphics are tighter and the "dating" powerup system adds a surprising amount of depth. The sense of artistic design in these games is really something splendid to behold--there's so much beauty packed into these simple, pre-PC style pixels, and as in the first, a satisfying story resolution. Apparently this didn't sell super well, so they aren't sure when or if they're making a sequel, but I hope more people will pick up on this gem... after all, that 3 bucks for a breezy game with replay value is money easily given and well spent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996800920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1492381632}
review: This is a disappointing and formulaic rehash of its free predecessor.  Only recommended if you play the free one, like it, and want to play something substantially the same as it.  Or if you want to fund the developer, who I give credit for releasing a fun game for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193426251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1492492008}
review: An excellent and charming game. After playing through the first game, Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt, I purchased this without hesitation. Makes me want to try creating a game in the ZX Spectrum graphical style.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973064382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1600034611}
review: These games are really unique and fun.  Recommend trying both.  Especially if you enjoy bit music too

author: {'steamid': '76561198271272995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1482580159}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197980151434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1592148803}
review: It's a short, fun (and very reasonably priced) Earthbound/MOTHER-esque adventure (...or perhaps the indie game OFF would be a better reference point, if you've ever played that), with a little side of kind of the Binding of Isaac-style combat...and maybe a little top-down shooter as well. I enjoyed it, and probably would play a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042196322', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1527458137}
review: Cute AF

author: {'steamid': '76561198028049202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1490650167}
review:
Fun little game. Like a retro RPG but with shoot em up battles. 

The first game is free and very similar to this, so you can play that first and pick this up if you want more.
I might have to rage-quit on the final boss though, but that's what I get for selecting the hardest difficulty on my first playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968748110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1491176957}
review:
The first game was awesome, and free, and I stated i'd pay for a seqeul.  Now, I did, and it's just as awesome as the first! I love the dating ability in the game to give you all kinds of new powers. The graphics and sound continue that classic Gameboy Color design in a perfect form.   The controls work fine for the purpose of being a Bullet-Hell game; however, sometimes I did find myself getting locked up in corners for some odd reason.  

Overall, i'd pay for anohter one of these games. They're fun, easy to pickup, and good to kill some time!   Like the last game, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093619033', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1489991466}
review: I absolutely recommend this game. If you have some free time and 3 dollars and haven't played either of these games (this one and it's prequel which is free I might add) then suggest playing the first one and then buying this one. They're an odd experience that has lots of silly humor in it with a not so bad story delievers exactly about what you expect for a 3 dollar game. Both games total up to around 4 hours on normal but if you get into the harder modes i've seen people get upwards of 8 hours out of both of them. Also apathetic frogs and bullethells? What could go wrong?

author: {'steamid': '76561198353290503', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1595, 'last_played': 1632791023}
review: This is an adorable little game and it's well worth your $3. Everything is so charming from the retro graphics to the awesome soundtrack to the cute and funny NPCs. The game is relatively short but it has quite a bit of replay value if you want experience the game with all the different abilities, get the secret 102% completion rating, and see everyone's dances at the end. The gameplay is a sort of mix between a bullet hell game and a classic NES RPG game. The game works the difficulty up as you progress with challenging boss fights and more enemies in later healing modes. If you want a more challenging experience DEATH mode will definitely supply it. There's honestly something here for everyone and it all coalesces into a short burst of fun that can be experienced over and over again. If you're at all a fan of bullet hell games and you want something that's an absolute blast to play through then purchase this game. If you're on the fence about it then try the first game in the series Princess Remedy in a World of Hurt. It's free! If it interests you then definitely consider adding this game to your library, it's worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965400045', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1526068110}
review: Addicting and fun as hell while it lasts.  Probably an hour long but worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077030943', 'num_games_owned': 2915, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1481881248}
review:
This prequel to the first game, Princess Remedy In A World of Hurt, went above and beyond expectations. Ludosity brings Princess Remedy back with equally compelling music, even more impressive pixel artwork, both additional and improved gameplay mechanics compared to the original, more colorful NPCs (in the sense of their physical color, but colorful in their witty and clever dialogue, too), and is still replete with a multitude of endings to experience. As for the answer to a question which is of great import to many: Yes, it is still quite the romantic game.

P.S. I would also like to point out there is a VERY interesting, yet easily missed, secret unrelated to file completion that is definitely worth checking out if you have the chance (refer to the Secrets thread in the Community Hub).

author: {'steamid': '76561198018476373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1486893837}
review: Fun little game. I might be in the minority in that I preferred In a World of Trouble slightly more, but perhaps whichever one you play first will be your favourite for that initial charm that wins you over.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995491919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1486618722}

author: {'steamid': '76561197998099551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1486247755}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988857583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4, 'last_played': 1580850417}
review: Princess Remedy is back! And so begins the mighty ship wars, where you ship Remedy with everyone and everything! The powerups are awesome and adds all new ways to play!

author: {'steamid': '76561198100496478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1485284045}
review:
I usually hate bullet hell styled games but I couldn't help adore the characters and the writing in this one. Most probably I was drawn in by nostalgia to NES styled games as well as its charming soundtrack. If you don't like bullet hells, it's probably not for you. However, if you don't mind them and want to play a charming one hour game, I recommend it. 

£2 in my opinion really isn't that much and the dev poured a lot of their heart and passion into this. This game is definitely the most enjoyable title I've played in a while.

If you're unsure, the first game is free so check that out before committing yourself to buying the 2nd title in the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080054140', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1485198976}
review:
Итак, начнём с того, что эта часть является приквелом к игре Princess Remedy In a World of Hurt, и принцесса Ремеди только обучается в Школе Лечения, собсна, навыкам лечения. 

Сюжет - 7/10
Насколько я понял, сюжет заключается в том, что вдруг откуда ни возьмись из-под земли выросла Босс Башня (Boss Tower в оригинале), по виду напоминающая дерево, заодно подняв с земли (btw действия игры разворачиваются на Сатурне, лол) все города. Жителям делать нечего - поэтому они и не против особо. Но со временем граждане-обыватели стали замечать, что их народ терроризируют различные болезни, от грусти и печали до вывиха шеи. Помочь всем жителям и, самое главное, Принцу сего Королевства, доверили ученице Сатурнийской школы лечения, принцессе Ремеди. Неплохо.

Геймплей - 7/10
Довольно однообразный bullet hell, но мне нравится :D

Графика - 8.5/10
8-битный графон мне по душе, поэтому за него ментальный лайкос разработчикам.

Музыкальное сопровождение - 7.5/10
В каждой локации она разная, что, в принципе, также не дает нам заскучать. Приятные и не надоедливые мелодии :)

Итог - 7.5/10 свиданий с цветочком!
Отличная игра, чтобы провести за ней часок-другой.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074771219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1485123898}
review: Qualcuno potrebbe chiedersi perché abbia speso soldi per questo giochino, in realtà avevo già giocato al predecessore gratuito e mi era piaciuto molto. Quindi mi sembrava giusto ripagare il grande Remar, anche perché così finanziamo i suoi futuri giochi "seri". Poi Princess Remedy svolge egregiamente il compito principale, quello di divertire, e il post-game è esilarante!

author: {'steamid': '76561198272962421', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1578229896}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970514344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1607722182}
review: More, more, more of what you liked A World of Hurt for. A fun mixture of simple RPG and intense shooter, with a simple Game Boy game design, Spectrum graphics, beautiful explosions, and funny dialogue. It's also quite hard. I felt like my Xbox One controller's D-pad wasn't as responsive in this game as it was in the previous game, but it worked well enough overall. Exploring the world and finding secrets brought me back to my Game Boy Classic days, when I braved the myriad lands of Final Fantasy Legends I and II. Great stuff. I hope we'll see more from these guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198312985592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1483717269}
review:
太太太太太好玩了( ﾟ∀。)比起world of hurt又加了不少要素。boss设计还是那么好看，弹幕飞起来紧张又刺激，15块丝毫不亏[strike]更何况还能打折[/strike]
吐槽一下明明是个弹幕游戏为什么最后的还会出现一个小音游，还意外好难，手忙脚乱都快吓哭了

author: {'steamid': '76561198179094542', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1483522277}
review:
Продолжение игры, пародирующей жанр JRPG.
В этой части:
- появились доп. способности
- получить эти способности можно, начав встречаться с любым из ранее спасенных существ
- наличие местного клона DDR для продолжения рода
- и, как всегда, много юмора и игры слов
Более чем достойное продолжение изначально скромного проекта.
7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058065270', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1483415819}
review:
Pretty fun. If you like the first game you'll like this too. It's slightly longer and your flask can now be replaced by all sorts of abilities depending on who you date. (Didn't Princess Remedy get married in the first game???)

[spoiler] The secret boss after the final boss is really really hard, even with level 6 power from the Jealous Chest.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198092619014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1483326222}
review: For 3 dollars, this game is a nice adventure and a big way to push the mechanics set by game 1. The dating is a nice way to get new bombs, and there's more than one boss this time! In fact a lot more than one. I'd recommend a buy, especially for how cheap it is. Support this series!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965615203', 'num_games_owned': 2853, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1483299303}
review: More Princess Remedy! If you liked the first game, you'll definitely like the second one. It's pretty much more of the same, but more polished.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969448087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483102770}
review: It's not too different than the first but has some nice features like alternate weapons, telling you when an area is clear and a very unique secret mode you probably won't miss. Played through this and the previous game for half the price of a latte from your favourite high street coffee retail outlet and you can't say fairer than that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975552692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1596405106}
review: I only recommend this game for ZX-Spectrum fans. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198034279566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482895440}
review:
Short, fun game. Offers as much challenge as you want. The normal mode is easy, beat it in around an hour without rushing. A lot of characters and charm to the game, interesting visual style too. But you will experience most of what the game has to offer in that one hour, the replayability comes from wanting to challenge yourself and play at higher difficulties.

There is a bonus mode (known as REALLYDAD) that you can learn how to access after beating the game. I found it pretty much unplayable and frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120936389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1482860246}
review:
Is it a fun game? Definitely. It has slightly more depth than the first, sure.

Is it worth 3 dollars for 2 hours? Maybe not. The first is free, and that's good enough.
